column2: The position holder will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations in the Asia time zone, ensuring that all processes and procedures are running smoothly and efficiently. This role requires excellent organizational and communication skills, as well as the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively. Be an individual contributor but work closely with the team to ensure they are engaged and motivated to think about Operational Excellence. The key responsibilities include:                     Service and Delivery: Prioritize incidents, Standard service requests, based on SLA lead time. Deliver to Line of business in accordance with agreed Service Level Agreements. Analyze data to find bottlenecks and remove/highlight these to management e.g. Analysis of on-hold column. Closing window coordination in collaboration with Service Managers. HAPO planning, communication, and coordination. Managing Hyper Care requests. Delivery of services 24/7 how to utilize the 3 times zones, set processes for tasks that are handed-over. Optimize and Manage Night Weekend -duty by data analysis with SO team.                       Optimisation Automations : Bring forward candidates for Optimisation automation to Product owners. Optimise ServiceNow functionality, which can support analysis and automation e.g. Portal forms, Vendor Manager Workspace. Responsible for Operational Excellence in the Asia time zone, working closely with the operations team to ensure high-quality FLOW. Continuously optimize processes and lead times to improve efficiency and productivity. Collaborate with Product Owners to suggest improvements to prevent recurring incidents. Work with ServiceNow data to monitor and improve performance metrics.                     Critical and Major incidents: Managing Major and Critical incidents in connection to communication and alignment between Products until the issue is solved. Ensure resolution of major/critical incidents by being part of the rotation with on-call support. Ensure fast resolution of major and critical incidents, with root cause analysis and mitigating actions taken to prevent reoccurrence.                     Communication collaboration: Communicate around standard upgrades and changes and what is that impact on the different sites. Engage with Sites around Delivery lead times, to align expectations. Close dialogue on resources (internal consultants) with Product Owner and People leaders e.g. Budget, Time for on-boarding. Close collaboration with Product Owners and transition plan once a Service must be moved from Development to Operations. Maintain good communication with LoB and stakeholders, including a team of 3 Operations Managers in different time zones.                     Focus on the Asia time zone, but also have global responsibility for Operational Excellence. Be respectful and motivating towards experienced people, leveraging their skills to drive success. Excellent communication skills in English (written/spoken). Ability to analyse and provide guidance on complex issues in a timely and structured manner. Budget and contract management.                     Qualifications                     Master s or Graduate degree in relevant field (Software Engineering, Economics, Computer Science, Business Administration) with Min12+yrs of experience in IT industry, preferably in the pharma industry or any regulatory industry.                     7+ years of experience in operations management (Incident, Problem and change management.                     Strong leadership and management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire a team.                     Excellent communication, organization, and problem-solving skills.                     Knowledge of best practices in operations management, including inventory management, supply chain, and production processes.                     Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.                     Proficient in Microsoft Office and experience with ERP systems.                     Experience working with ServiceNow data and analytics to drive improvements.                     Able to work in Asia time zone.                     Basic experience is required in Optimisation Automations.

column2: The IT AOA BSI Operations Manager will be working across multiple vendors, markets and streams and must have a very strong leadership skill to promote the integration amongst Business, IT (Information Technology) Streams and Partners (at all levels of the organization) ensuring a high quality of sustain operations and continuous improvements on the IT products and processes fully supporting business evolution, where key focus areas are automation, AIOps and Continuous Improvement to ensure operational excellence.                                 A day in the life of ADI                                 Reporting to the Sr Global Vendor and Operations Manager for Business Solution Integration (BSI) in ADI, responsibilities of this role include:                                 Increase business centricity & Improve communication with the business and within IT streams.                             Integrate the different IT areas and the business.                             Problem management & root cause analysis leading to operational excellence.                             Data analysis to discover problem area trends and opportunity for improvements.                             Increase speed of response / resolutions through a higher sense of urgency.                             Focus on AIOps, Automation and Continuous Improvement to reduce impact to our receivers and promote a sustainable operational environment.                             Contribution to IT Strategy.                             Documents training materials for the product area and delivers training to the end users, deployment and support teams.                              Identifies gaps in existing functionalities, options for improvement and opportunities for process automation.                              Responsible for identifying security & compliance requirements, including roles, associated with our scoped applications and services.                                          What will make you successful                                             Joining a collaborative team of Operations Managers, you will be a strong team player with a history of delivering results in a high pressure and dynamic environment.                             Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business administration or related field, or equivalent work experience.                             Strong communication skills                             Curiosity & Quick learner. Proactivity & strong collaboration. Leading change to drive continuous improvement mindset, and Problem solving mindset driving insights to action.                             4+ years of experience in IT, preferred with experience in agile methodologies                              Understanding of various SAP and non-SAP solution integration technologies. Examples: Process Integration, Cloud Process Integration, Data Services - BODS; familiarity with SAP transactions, tables, navigation and data objects.                             As a plus, if you have knowledge on OpenText Platform (B2B/EDI), Mulesoft (or API platform), Azure (Data Factory, Logic Apps, Event Driven Architecture), Service Now, Knowledge of Hybrid integration platforms spanning cloud and on-premise (iPaaS, PaaS, SaaS).                              Experience supporting business critical operations.                             Understanding of end to end (E2E) business flows.                             Ability to review incidents and determine repeating trends in issues.                             Experience in service management principles and execution                             Demonstrated experience in establishing standard processes and managing performance to achieve key metrics                             Experience explaining technical concepts and technologies                             Experience working in a global environment and with virtual teams                             Effective communication and presentation skills are vital as you develop working partnerships with internal and external stakeholders, such as service integrators, service provides and vendors across the globe (face-to-face and remote)                             With stakeholders based in various time zones, flexibility is essential as you participate in teleconferences and activities outside of standard business hours.                             Nestle offers flexible working hours and working from home, enabling you on how to get your job done and will help you balance your work with your personal commitments.

Tracking and solving the dispute in collection and drive E-T-E process streamline and reduce overdue payment. Manage teams and ensure compliance with targets and KPIs                      Build, Develop and Promote Talent - coach and mentor team                      Participate in country/regional/global activities as assigned                      Other Ad Hoc tasks required by the team not listed above. Minimum 7 to 10 years of experience in AR, Finance, Collection and Credit Management.                      Fluent in English.                      Excellent communication skills, ability to maintain the good relationship with the stakeholders in local market and globally. understanding of sales, marketing, customer and post-sale processes     You will work cross-functionally to streamline operations, manage support queues in a timely manner, improve data accuracy, drive revenue growth, and manage our growing Revenue Operations resources in region     The ideal candidate is analytical, detail-oriented, and possesses strong leadership and communication skills         About Us          When you join iCIMS, you join the team helping global companies transform business and the world through the power of talent     Our customers do amazing things: design rocket ships, create vaccines, deliver consumer goods globally, overnight, with a smile     As the Talent Cloud company, we empower these organizations to attract, engage, hire, and advance the right talent     we're passionate about helping companies build a diverse, winning workforce and about building our home team     Were dedicated to fostering an inclusive, purpose-driven, and innovative work customer NPS     Emphasis on growing analytical skill set to optimize workload across the entire team     Help to manage various support queues while assessing the inquiries to determine recurring issues that can be addressed via proactive process improvements      Working with the other Revenue Operations leaders     oversee the accuracy and completeness of data in our CRM system Analyze column2: Becoming a part of a high performance team while leading a team of 2 to 4 Team Managers and a span of 40 to 60 reinsurance account handlers         Driving the organizational strategy to ensure continuous improvement in operations team through process, people, and quality         Taking complete ownership of end to end delivery of reinsurance fiduciary tasks         Contributing to making a positive difference in the customer service and exceeding client expectations via strong operational rigor and delivery. Also ensuring that all compliance and regulatory requirements are met and maintained as per required standards         Being bold in thinking and bringing innovative solutions to any barriers faced through the first 3-6 months, you will be actively supported by your peers to help understand the ways of working                     What is in it for you?                 An opportunity to lead a team of people supporting various Geographies and engagement with senior leaders on strategic discussions.         Opportunity to enhance your knowledge in Insurance/Reinsurance broking domain as well as Leadership skills.         Immense opportunity to lead Change Management initiatives as teams will be undergoing system/process migration         Leading operational delivery for the team/BU/entities assigned and provide dashboard and metrics to show trends, figures and business insight         People (team) engagement and development         Opportunity to work with global leads on various initiatives (process improvement, automation)                     We will count on you for:                 Core accountabilities:                 Prompts issuing of statements, collection of receivable and payment of payable balances to secure the collection of outstanding fiduciary balances.         Drives personal cash processing and fiduciary targets, including the use of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for highly complex accounts to facilitate reporting from the CSS Dashboard and other system tools.         Manages assigned portfolio of Market/Client accounts to ensure all deadlines are met and time bound activities are addressed within defined parameters including (but not limited to) cash allocation, collections of brokerage and billings and resolution of fiduciary exposures. Assignments include accounts with moderate level of complexity.         Participates in regular dialogue and have frequent personal interaction with Market/Client contacts in order to resolve issues that are related to payment and collection and are of moderate complexity.         Provides detailed information on collection/remittance process in order to support Request for Proposal (RFP) and sales opportunities.         Leads gathering inputs for the evolution of the operational model at moderately complex levels of the organization to drive new process improvement ideas leveraging technology solutions.         Leads relationships with Brokers, Clients and Markets in order to understand issues, resolve problems and queries and review working practices.         Leads strategic team meetings and activities in order to drive sharing of opinions, ideas, knowledge and solutions and facilitates opportunities for team learning.                 SLA - Monitor SLA management to ensure continuous improvement in delivering value/superior customer experience to stakeholders. Have insights on data available and create plans for achievement of annual operation goals. Ownership for timely delivery to the client either as per laid SLA s or as agreed with the client, whichever is earlier         Metrics Management - Manage all the financial metrics and maintain the outstanding positions below the target levels         Stakeholder Management - Responsible for creating a rapport with onshore managers to be able to garner a long-term working relationship with them. This in turn should help the incumbent better appreciate the challenges of the stakeholder and have a view of their short - medium term plans to ensure readiness in India         Provides meaningful contributions in stakeholder and client meetings with insights, presentations, and/or reports         New Migration - Identify new work opportunities through regular stakeholder interactions to increase cost efficiencies for operating companies. Create a knowledge environment in the team to ensure continuous learning from members on end-to-end business environment, processes, skills, competencies and create efficiencies for future business opportunities         SOP & Exception Management - Ownership of delivery as well as decisions on SOPs within defined frameworks and boundaries to ensure smooth functioning of day-to-day operations in a team. Incumbent will be required to ensure zero escalation. Manage exceptional/urgent/out-of-turn requests for work basis business priorities to ensure a balance between stakeholder and people expectations         Utilization & Resource Management - Efficient utilization of all available resources in Operations team (people, systems, knowledge) to ensure timely, cost efficient and quality delivery to stakeholders. column2: Avalara is seeking an experienced and qualified Manager of HCM Operations, focused on supporting the core areas of our HRIS Technology like Workday and iCIMS.                          ?         A day in the life:                 Each day, you'll engage with your global People Culture (HR) Finance stakeholders ranging from Benefits and Compensation to Payroll and HR Operations       As a trusted partner, you'll use your expertise to design great technology solutions and make recommendations to your stakeholders     As a dynamic people leader, you'll lead your team through the configuration, testing, and deployment of solutions on the Workday and iCIMS platforms, while helping them learn and grow their individual careers     As an individual contributor, you will have the opportunity to design new solutions and troubleshoot problems to ensure that our platforms are running optimally     Finally, as an ethical Avalarian, you'll operate with integrity and use your elevated privilege with care         Lead the execution of operational Workday HCM activities including (but not limited to): post-production maintenance and support, enhancements release management, troubleshooting and defect resolution, daily/monthly/yearly events management.         Lead and operationalize recurring technology events like Annual Open Enrollment, Annual Performance, and Annual Compensation (Merit/Bonus) in partnership with appropriate stakeholders.         Oversee post-production activities on the Workday and iCIMS platforms like defect troubleshooting and resolution, small enhancements including workflow and business process changes, security administration, system testing, and deployment support.          Define and drive key performance indicators (KPIs) and service level agreement (SLA) baselines and metrics         Develop and operationalize applicable reporting and analytics to measure the effectiveness and efficiency of end-to-end processes         Drive continuous improvement and automation of operational activities to improve effectiveness and efficiency         Determine which opportunities to pursue with a focus on reducing process costs, increasing efficiency, enhancing the user experience and maximizing returns on investment         Create a prioritized, metric-driven pipeline of technology improvements and opportunities with associated governance         Serve as liaison between technical and business resources         Safely and ethically handle sensitive data by adhering to all data handling standards and regulations         Lead and manage a team of Workday experts and mentor junior members of the team               Minimum Qualifications:               Bachelors Degree or equivalent in a related field (Human Resource, Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, etc)         8+ years working in a Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) environment with Workday, iCIMS, and/or WorkRamp.         3+ years with multiple Workday modules including HCM, Talent, Compensation, Benefits, Absence, and Payroll         3+ years of experience in direct people leadership         Experience with leading at least 2 full life cycle Workday HCM implementations         Demonstrated strong technical aptitude and capabilities, particularly in an HRIS environment with applications like Workday, iCIMS, and/or WorkRamp         Excellent written and verbal communication skills               Preferred Qualifications:               Workday PRO Certification         Functional knowledge in domains like HR, Payroll, Recruiting         Software experience, preferably in a Software as a Service (SaaS) environment             At Avalara, we believe that successful employees demonstrate these Success Traits, which are drawn from our DNA and discussions about our most successful new hires and employees. Therefore, the ideal candidate for Vice President of Business Technology will have these traits:             Ownership: Taking full accountability for the success and growth of the HCM Operations team, ensuring successful and efficient delivery of all solutions.         Passion: Inspiring the team with a commitment to innovation and excellence, driving continuous improvement and exceptional results.         Adaptability: Navigating and adapting to evolving business needs and technological landscapes, ensuring strategies remain relevant and effective.         Humility: Fostering a collaborative and inclusive team culture, valuing individual contributions and celebrating collective success.         Fun: Injecting positivity and camaraderie into the work environment, fostering creativity and collaboration among team members.         Optimism: Approaching challenges with confidence and resilience, turning obstacles into opportunities for growth and advancement.         Curiosity: Cultivating a culture of continuous learning and exploration, encouraging team members to seek new ideas and solutions.         Urgency: Instilling a sense of drive and purpose, ensuring initiatives are executed efficiently and with a focus on delivering value, and moving quickly to solve problems.         Simplicity: Emphasizing clarity and efficiency in processes and communication, streamlining operations to drive effectiveness and success.           How Well Take Care of You             Total Rewards             In addition to a great compensation package, paid time off, and paid parental leave, many Avalara employees are eligible for bonuses.             Health Wellness             Benefits vary by location but generally include private medical, life, and disability insurance.             Inclusive culture and diversity             Avalara strongly supports diversity, equity, and inclusion, and is committed to integrating them into our business practices and our organizational culture. We also have a total of 8 employee-run resource groups, each with senior leadership and exec sponsorship.

column2: Skill required:  Strategic / Business Enablement - Business Insights Designation:  Associate Manager Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 11 - 14 Years  About Accenture Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security.Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations services, and Accenture Song all powered by the worlds largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 699,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities.Visit us at www.accenture.com  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Business Process Delivery and help us supervise the day-to-day operational and administrative activities, ensuring all processes are followed/executed and deadlines are met. You will be working as a part of Operations Excellence team which drives continuous improvement projects and interact with client or internal stakeholders to drive and influence improvement objectives. This team is responsible for breaking down the end to end process to identify automation/improvement opportunities and create automation/transformation road-maps. This team is also responsible for delivering large scale end-to-end process transformation projects for global clients. In this role, you will apply experience and knowledge of general business concepts and industry, cultural and economic trends to maximize efficiency and effectiveness. What are we looking for? The Time&Expense Change Management and V&A Associate Manager is responsible for providing change management, communications delivery, and acquisitions program management support for the global Time&Expense (T&E) business function. strong collaboration skills and ability to drive results across cross-functional, multi-level and multi-geography teams  Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail  Agile and quick to adapt, able to accelerate a learning curve, especially with technology  Ability to work under minimal supervision, self-driven  Proficiency in Microsoft office suite: PowerPoint, Excel, and Word applications  Proficiency in WordPress (Internal Sites development and maintenance) and Yammer

column2: Location : India (Remote-WFH) - As an Operational Strategy Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing the operational strategy for launching our product in India. - You will work closely with Dr. Gopinath, and the leadership team to develop a comprehensive plan for market entry, including identifying target customers, developing pricing and packaging strategies, establishing partnerships with key stakeholders, and building a high-performing team. Responsibilities : - Develop and execute the operational strategy for launching our product in India. - Identify target customer segments and develop a comprehensive understanding of their needs and pain points. - Develop pricing and packaging strategies that are tailored to the Indian market. - Establish partnerships with key stakeholders, such as technology providers, marketing agencies, and local business associations. - Build and manage a high-performing team of professionals to support the launch and ongoing operations. - Conduct market research and analysis to inform business decisions. - Manage and optimize operational processes to ensure efficiency and effectiveness. - Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of the product launch and ongoing operations. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, product, and engineering, to ensure alignment and effective execution of the operational strategy. Qualifications : - Master's degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, or a related field from a Leading Institution is a must.(IIM / ISB / SPJ/ FMS/ MDI / XLRI only) - 1+ years of experience in operations management, business development, or related roles. - Experience in developing and executing operational strategies for launching new products or businesses in India. - Experience in managing and leading cross-functional teams in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to use data to drive business decisions. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues and external partners. - Fluency in English and Hindi is required, proficiency in additional languages is a plus. Application Process : To apply for this role, please submit your resume and a cover letter that includes answers to the following questions : - What experience do you have in developing and executing operational strategies for launching new products or businesses in India? - How would you approach identifying target customer segments and developing pricing and packaging strategies for our product in India? - What are the key challenges that you anticipate in launching our product in India, and how would you address them? - What is your leadership style, and how do you motivate and inspire teams to achieve their goals? We look forward to hearing from you and thank you for your interest. US Shift (PST- 7pm to 4am)  Work from Home

Review and verify customer identification documents, including but not limited to passports, driver's licenses, and utility bills. Analyze customer profiles and transactional activity to identify potential risks and suspicious behavior. Collaborate with other departments, such as compliance and legal, to resolve KYC-related issues and escalate concerns when necessary. Stay informed about relevant regulatory developments and update internal policies and procedures accordingly. Provide training and guidance to staff members on KYC requirements and best practices. Maintain accurate records of KYC documentation and correspondence with customers. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business administration, or a related field. Previous experience in KYC compliance or a similar role in the financial services industry. Strong understanding of KYC principles. Excellent attention to detail and ability to perform thorough research and analysis. Proficiency in using KYC tools and software. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment. Relevant professional certifications (e.g., CAMS, ACAMS) preferred but not required.

column2: Role Description Cash Management Operation is one of the significant revenue contributors in India. The Head of Payment - Domestic and Cross Border position is a senior management position in Operations. The position holder through the management of a team is responsible to support client and meeting regulatory and compliance requirements for Cash Operations in India. Your key responsibilities The staff is responsible for the accurate and timely processing of all types of payments Domestic and Cross border, as well as the handling of investigations and related regulatory compliance. The candidate is expected to have sound knowledge of Foreign Exchange Management Act (Current and Capital account transaction) for cross border payment processing in India. This includes the processing of time-critical, complex transactions on behalf of the Banks internal and external clients, cash-related investigations involving enquiries from clients and internal stakeholders. It often involves complex or in some cases regulated tasks including interaction with clients, internal and external stakeholders. The staff undertakes monitoring of complete and accurate capturing of payment transactions, ensuring that all payment-related information and relevant parties are processed according to established Service Level Agreement (SLAs) and regulatory guidelines. The candidate should be familiar with regulatory requirements regarding Domestic and Cross border transaction including Nodal Account operations and compliance requirements. In addition, the staff must ensure that procedures are properly documented to reduce processing risk and identify potential areas for process improvement whether internally within the Bank or for our clients. Staff may need to deal with the escalation and remediation of client complaints as well as managing relationships with the front office and other internal and external parties at an appropriate level. Lead the efforts and all possible initiatives to constantly improve the STP rates in payments and Cash management operations with direct impact on the Cut of Time offer proposed by the Bank to Clients. Make sure all operational procedures and permanent controls are well in place harmonized and enforced across all products. Contribute and coordinate with IT teams Operation Engineer team onto new systems/features deployment impacting cash management while guaranteeing the proper execution of operations eg digitalization initiatives, regulatory rollouts etc. Constantly work on process improvisation and efficiency initiatives. Contribute in the roll out of new processes and adoption of operational controls in line with updates or changes in Group Compliance/ Regulatory Requirements as it impacts Cash Management Operations. Stakeholder management  Work with Mumbai Domestic Payments team to ensure timely and accurate processing of transactions. Governance over DIPL/3rd party vendor teams responsible for execution of transactions and related work. Co-ordinate with internal stakeholders such as Front Office, Compliance, Central Treasury Team etc. Collaborate with Cash Products and Technology teams to run and implement Transformation Projects. Your skills and experience Graduate/Post Graduate Degree from a reputed university. 15+ years of experience in managing large teams for Domestic & Cross Border Payments. Proven track record of delivering operational excellence and in driving collaboration across multi-product and functional teams, in context of varied local regulations, market practices, technologies and processes. Experienced leader with proven ability in managing stakeholder relationships across Front Office, Mid and BackOffice teams. Leadership skills which enable the candidate to successfully influence peers, direct and indirect reports. History of leading complex execution impacting product, function, process and technology related changes. Proven track record in successfully leading complex and critical transitions.

column1: Business Information Records Officer - Team Lead
column2: Role Description This role is for a VP level BIRO responsible for the operational aspects of ensuring compliance with the Records Management Policy for the 500+ applications managed by CB Operations Divisional CISO. Role requirements includes To drive, facilitate and oversee the implementation of the Records Management policy within CB Operations To ensure the implementation of controls for identified records management risks in their area of responsibility. The BIRO ensures that an appropriate dispensation to accept the residual risk identified due to the lack of controls is obtained. To provide timely updates to senior management regarding records management tasks To ensure that application entries regarding records management in the Groups inventory of applications are accurate and up to date. Keep oneself informed of the Records Management Policy and its subordinate documents and liaise with any other necessary parties to accomplish their tasks. These resources may be e.g., the TISO, ITAO or any other subject matter experts. To ensure appropriate documentation of records management in area of responsibility. This includes major decisions including identified and assessed risks as well as risk mitigation measures. To initiate processes with management to obtain appropriate funding to facilitate the enforcement of the records management in their area of responsibility. Your key responsibilities To coordinate the identification and provision of Unit-specific training needs to be addressed beyond the annual mandatory Records Management training provided to all Employees. To coordinate the creation and maintenance of the Units Record Inventory and associated Record Classes using the Record Taxonomy embedded in the Mandatory Retention Schedule (MRS). To maintain an understanding of the Units business locations and activities (e.g. trading products and processes) to ensure coverage of the Record Inventory and communicate changes to the Inventory Owner and GRMO during the annual attestation process. To coordinate the annual Record Inventory attestation and retain evidence of the completed Record Inventory attestation and sign-off by the Inventory Owner and share this evidence with GRMO which maintains centrally all annual Record Inventory attestations and sign-offs. To support the Information Technology Application Owner (ITAO) by assessing applications In-Development ahead of their promotion to In-Production status for Records relevance. To review and maintain details of the impact of UBR changes on In-Scope ECOM recorded Employees within their Unit and secure approval from Unit head for material changes. To review potential applicability of Legal Hold notices received from General Counsel or designated delegate to assist with placement of Legal Holds on relevant Data and Records. To monitor Records reaching their applicable Retention Period and oversee the disposal eligibility checks including those for Legal Holds and Tax Holds. To assume responsibility for securing disposal approval from the Inventory Owner and GRMO. Your skills and experience VP level experience in Records Management, reporting, governance and people management Senior level understanding of Records management policies Ability to understand and communicate technology around records management.

column2: The Operations Manager will be responsible for ensuring the service quality and efficiency of MJGDLs operations.      The Operations Manager will report to the COO of iwoca (based in London, UK), and will also work closely with the Director of MJGDL (based in Hyderabad). They will be based in the Gachibowli office, and will be responsible for both sites.        Responsibilities          Team scope and processes          Drive operational excellence across MJGDL, through effective management of both the quality and efficiency of every team      Ensure there is a comprehensive and accurate Statement of Work in place, which fully reflects the processes and service levels agreed between iwoca and MJGDL      Ensure delivery of the Statement of Work, ensuring the team adheres to agreed SLAs (Service Level Agreement) and achieves KPI targets      Managing any issues which arise and providing updates / escalating issues as necessary to iwoca stakeholders      Work with UK-based teams to identify additional processes which could be managed by Team India, and how to make those processes streamlined and reliable      Ensure adequate resources are available for current and future workloads across each team      Understand iwoca product or strategy changes and how they translate to changes for Team India      Manage budgets and monthly invoice billing to iwoca      Explore and test ideas this role offers a lot of latitude for identifying what improvements need to be made and then delivering value from them          People & Culture            Maintain a happy, motivated and engaged workforce at MJGDL, across all teams and locations      Manage the recruitment process for new starters from interview processes to onboarding      Establish and implement effective performance management processes, e.g. around how performance reviews are conducted, bonus frameworks, salary reviews, etc.      Organise team events and recognition initiatives      Keep up to date with and execute any new India guidelines such as women safety and escalate any new insurance/payroll guidelines where necessary      Glean ideas and inspiration for how to develop a successful people strategy for MJGDL, by working closely with iwocas People Operations team          Facilities            Responsible for both offices facilities and IT; ensure adequate office space and IT equipment is available to all staff for them to work effectively      Liaise and negotiate with contractors and suppliers to ensure we get the best deals      Support the Director of MJGDL as needed to ensure the smooth running of MJGDL and compliance with its legal responsibilities          What were looking for            You will likely have a minimum 7+ years work experience, with operational experience in a tech / high-growth environment      Business conversational English is a must(spoken and written)      Fluent Hindi and Telugu speaking is a solid plus      A top-class degree from a reputable university      Proven ability to set clear priorities, with very strong organisational, issue resolution, and decision-making skills      A track record of building and managing operational teams      A fine balance of confidence, gravitas, humility and enthusiasm. Empathy to connect with, manage and motivate a growing team, while maintaining authority and a really high performance bar for the entire team      Passionate about establishing and maintaining healthy team cultures - you recognise the importance of team engagement to drive performance and you have experience of implementing strategies to achieve this      Experience of managing performance issues when they arise, able to make tough decisions when necessary      Youll be keen to roll your sleeves up to get the things done when they need doing, even the small tasks which make a big difference      Experience of managing a range of stakeholders is essential, and ideally experience of working with international stakeholders      Willing to travel to our London office for a week or so annually      Need to be flexible to work UK hours. column2: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Operations Manager to oversee the efficient functioning of our salon and spa. The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership qualities, exceptional organizational skills, and a passion for delivering outstanding customer service. As the Operations Manager, you will be responsible for managing daily operations, ensuring smooth workflow, and maintaining high standards of quality and cleanliness throughout the facility. Responsibilities: Operations Management: Oversee the day-to-day operations of the salon and spa, including staff scheduling, inventory management, and facility maintenance. Develop and implement operational policies and procedures to enhance efficiency and productivity. Monitor and analyze key performance indicators to identify areas for improvement and implement solutions accordingly. Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements and health and safety standards. Staff Management: Recruit, train, and supervise salon and spa staff, including hairstylists, estheticians, massage therapists, and receptionists. Provide ongoing coaching and performance feedback to staff to foster a culture of excellence and teamwork. Schedule staff shifts and manage labor costs effectively to optimize staffing levels and meet business demands. Customer Service Excellence: Maintain a high level of customer service by ensuring that client needs are met promptly and professionally. Handle customer inquiries, complaints, and feedback in a timely and satisfactory manner. Implement initiatives to enhance the overall customer experience and build long-term client relationships. Financial Management: Develop and manage the salon and spa budget, including revenue forecasting, expense control, and profitability analysis. Monitor financial performance against targets and take corrective action as necessary to achieve business objectives. Identify opportunities for revenue growth and cost savings through strategic pricing and resource optimization. Marketing and Promotions: Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and execute marketing strategies and promotional campaigns to attract new customers and retain existing ones. Monitor market trends and competitor activities to identify opportunities for business development and differentiation. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Hospitality Management, or related field preferred. Proven experience in salon and spa management or a similar role, with a minimum of 3-5 years of relevant experience. Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire a diverse team. Excellent organizational and problem-solving abilities, with keen attention to detail. Proficiency in computer skills, including MS Office and salon management software. Knowledge of industry trends, best practices, and regulatory requirements. Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written. Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed. Benefits: Competitive salary commensurate with experience. Health insurance and other benefits package. Opportunities for professional development and career advancement. A supportive and inclusive work environment with a focus on employee well-being and satisfaction.

column2: Equitas Small Finance Bank Ltd. is looking for Operations Officer - Account Processing Unit to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Strategic Planning: Collaborating with senior management to develop and implement operational strategies aligned with the organization's goals and objectives      This may involve analyzing market trends, identifying opportunities for growth and efficiency improvements, and formulating strategic plans to enhance overall operational performance      Process Improvement: Identifying inefficiencies and bottlenecks in operational processes and workflows, and implementing measures to streamline and optimize these processes      This may include redesigning workflows, implementing new technologies, and introducing best practices to improve productivity and reduce costs      Resource Management: Overseeing the allocation and utilization of resources such as manpower, equipment, and materials to ensure optimal efficiency and productivity      This may involve workforce planning, resource allocation, and inventory management to meet operational requirements while minimizing waste and excesses      Quality Assurance: Implementing quality assurance measures and standards to ensure that products or services meet established quality requirements and customer expectations      This may involve developing quality control procedures, conducting inspections and audits, and implementing corrective actions to address quality issues      Risk Management: Identifying operational risks and implementing risk mitigation strategies to safeguard the organization's assets, reputation, and interests      This may involve assessing potential risks, developing contingency plans, and implementing internal controls to mitigate operational risks effectively      Compliance and Regulatory Oversight: Ensuring compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards governing the organization's operations      This may involve monitoring changes in regulatory requirements, implementing compliance programs, and conducting audits to ensure adherence to legal and regulatory standards      Performance Monitoring and Reporting: Monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) and operational metrics to evaluate performance against targets and benchmarks      This may involve collecting and analyzing data, preparing performance reports, and presenting findings to senior management to support decision-making and continuous improvement efforts

column2: OVERVIEW: HCL BSERV Healthcare is looking for the above position for its client, a large US based DME Company. The client is a multi- billion-dollar company providing healthcare products and services, including oxygen and respiratory equipment. JOB SUMMARY This position is responsible for day-to-day management of the staff in support of (HCL Clients) healthcare business operations overseeing all back office and claims processing activities. The position is also responsible for definition and application of business rules, work queue assignment & monitoring, transaction monitoring & processing, In addition, this position is responsible for identifying, recommending and implementing process & system solutions with a focus on a great customer experience and a cost-effective, high-performing operation Essential Duties and Responsibilities   Manage day-to-day operations and      directs the team responsible for Healthcare RCM back office/transaction management      activities Manage and meet performance targets for average handle time, Client SLA, quality , outcome measures and customer satisfaction Manage a group of Team Leads responsible for management of back office agents and SMEs.  Coordinate with internal support functions such as      Quality, WPC, Training, Admin, HR  Ensure quality and efficiency      measures are met within the team and in accordance with service level      agreements Provide coaching and feedback to      direct report positions to ensure satisfactory performance levels Use business tools and advanced Healthcare      RCM knowledge to identify problem areas and document business requirements Identify and recommend operational      and technological tools to improve efficiency Work with operations and information      technology personnel to resolve issues and improve operational efficiency Establish and maintain effective      work procedures Review, assess and identify      coaching & training needs to provide staff with necessary skills and      knowledge  Understand, communicate and      implement strategic direction and leadership for HCL to ensure consistent      and cohesive business objectives and to enhance customers experiences in      both a regulated and a competitive market. Plan and monitor operations      initiatives to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the back office Review and ensure processes are in      compliance with internal policies and external regulations.  Respond to escalated issues      regarding performance and quality. Coordinate, participate, and/or      manage multiple projects assigned by senior management, providing input on      operations related matters. Interface and coordinate with      various stakeholders Responsible for meeting the      revenue targets and also the Margins based on business plan  EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE The minimum education requirements are: Bachelors degree in any stream (may      substitute two years of relevant experience per one year of required      education) The minimum experience requirements are: Eight to Twelve years of relevant work experience-: US Healthcare RCM experience (preferably Provider AR management)  Min. 3 Yrs of Managerial exp. in similar rolls for E3.1 Five years of experience supervising professional workgroups (SME / team leaders) Experience      in managing customer/supplier relationships SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES  Exceptional leadership skills, including the ability to manage through a shared vision and path to success Ability to create, communicate and manage SLA metrics that support operational targets  Excellent problem solving skills and ability to use good judgment to make decisions  Possess exceptional people management skills enabling effective interaction with internal, external customers, employees, peers, and management  Strong analytical skills and desire to research problems to seek resolution  Exceptional verbal and written communication skills  Exceptional customer service abilities to handle difficult customers on calls, or present during review meetings Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Excel, word and powerpoint) Work effectively in a team environment  Strong time management and organizational skills PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS   Operating in a fast-paced professional office environment May require domestic and overseas travel Position may include an alternating weekend day as part of the regular weekly schedule Use of a PC, computer terminal and/or telephone over 4 hours a day Expected to work on premises alongside the team wherever possible

column2: Support the achievement of qualitative and sustainable growth through good corporate governance practice.          Reduce and mitigate the risk of financial losses or damage caused by non-compliant conduct.          Protect and further enhance the value and reputation of the company and its brands through compliant conduct.        The BPDD Operations Manager will work in close partnership with compliance, legal, procurement, GBS Operations, IT, and other relevant functions in the further implementation of the Business Partner Due Diligence process. The BPDD Operations Manager will work on the identification of high risk business partners and will have frequent interaction with the Global Compliance Network to drive the Business Partner Due Diligence process.        Key Responsibilities          Responsible for maintaining the Business Partner Due Diligence process within the Company, to ensure we partner with business partners who share our values.          Further implement the Business Partner Due Diligence process including managing a system for documenting and processing all existing and new business partners as well as act as point of contact for business stakeholders          Ensure the identification of high risk business partners and engage the right stakeholder to take appropriate action          Assure the implementation of the Global Business Partner Due Diligence Policy in collaboration with the Global Compliance Team and advise when a partner is not suitable from a risk or compliance point of view as per corporate guidelines          Translate screening results via lessons learnt into actions and communicate these to company stakeholders and answer questions from the business          Perform risk based due diligence on third parties with focus on medium and high risk third parties and consult stakeholders in third party review process          Systematically analyse risks and opportunities as well as monitoring current third parties in the system by periodic re-screening and reporting          Key Relationships          Global Compliance Team          Global Procurement Team          Global Legal Team          GBS Operations          Global Sales          Knowledge, Skills and Abilities          Fluent in English, additional language skills would be advantegeous          Abiltiy to understand compliance risk and business acumen          Work experience in a similar role within a large multinational corporate Compliance, Audit or Due Diligence function will be regarded as a plus          Knowledge of Business Partner Due Diligence and the Procurement process is advantageous          Promote compliance culture and demonstrable proof of integrity          QUALIFICATIONS:          6+ years relevant work experience          Degree in Business Management, Economics or related areas;

column2: A career in our Advisory Acceleration Centre is the natural extension of PwC s leading class global delivery capabilities.      ?     We provide premium, cost effective, high quality services that support process quality and delivery capability in support for client engagements.             As a    Consulting Senior Manager    in PwC s Financial Services Digital Operations practice, you ll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to tackle complex business issues from strategy to execution. Key responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:         Collaborate and contribute as a project team leader and as a team member to deliver complex financial services engagements spanning multiple sectors, including    Banking   ,    Capital Markets   ,    Insurance   , and    Asset Management           Work with leading financial services institutions to deliver significant programs in the areas of:         Digital transformation         Operational excellence         Customer & employee experience         Risk & compliance management         Payments transformation         Organizational transformation         Business case development         Execution planning & roadmap development           Be part of a community of practitioners that are committed to building sustainable relationships with clients and continuously improving service offerings to be relevant in the market     Engage with senior client stakeholders and be adept at leading cross-functional teams to identify issues & gaps, co-create solutions, and develop both strategic & tactical recommendations that will help clients deliver on their business objectives     Collaborate across the PwC network to conduct research on leading & sound practices and build compelling insights     Identify, qualify, and close opportunities to deliver services with new and existing clients     Provide guidance and recommendations on project direction such as setting priority of work packages, resource allocation, and deliverable quality standards     Participate in the development of practice thought leadership, and support business development efforts across the digital operations practice areas     Actively mentor and coach team members and other junior resources within the Acceleration Center, including providing feedback and guidance on work performance     Continue to advance skills, knowledge and network related to your area of specialization                         Experiences and skills you ll use to solve             Relevant consulting experience with a top-tier consulting firms, or internal consulting divisions of major financial institutions     6-8 years of experience in the financial services sector (e.g. Banking, Capital Markets, Insurance, Asset Management) with expertise in one of the following competency areas: target operating model design, process design, change management, payments, operational risk management, customer experience     Preferred MBA from tier-1 business school     Proven experience in analyzing and solving complex business challenges that require cross-functional expertise     Track record of managing large programs involving multiple workstreams and stakeholders     Exposure to multiple financial services sectors would be preferred     Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including developing PowerPoint presentations with an aptitude for compelling storytelling     Sound working knowledge of digital and analytics capabilities & trends within financial services would be an asset     Certifications in the areas of Lean, Six-sigma, and Agile would is a plus     A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences, developing and coaching diverse teams, and ensuring diverse perspectives are heard

column2: Support the Line Manager in their execution of SEA policies, projects and work programmes                                     Identify the areas of risk to adidas in respect of working conditions and standards. Provide to the Line Manager recommendations in respect of those risks, based on legal obligations and SEA requirements                                     Engage the adidas production staff and factory management in the designated country or countries in order to integrate SEA requirements into the business practices of adidas                                      Develop and provide regular SEA training to adidas Sourcing staff and factories within designated country or countries.                                      Audit and develop SEA action plans for suppliers, to ensure compliance with the SEA. Similarly, supervise the independent monitoring process in partner factories within designated country or countries.                                     Assist business partners remediation by advising on options, negotiating timeframes, sharing experiences and best practices and helping management locate the necessary expertise, materials, etc                                     Provide regular updates to the Line Manager, the relevant Country Manager(s) and Sourcing staff, on the status of partner factories and other suppliers, and SEA Team activities.                                      Ensure all relevant Sourcing staff and department heads are fully briefed in the SEA principles and methods of implementation.                                     Regarding communication, convey any problems and issues to all concerned parties immediately. Provide monthly reports to the Line Manager by the established reporting date.                                      Communicate news, issues and initiatives which originate in the LO to the Line Manager promptly and clearly.                                     Keep updated on all labour related and HSE legislation within the designated country or countries and report any updates to the Line Manager and Sourcing Unit . Review any updates with senior factory management and other SEA team members.                                     Establish contacts and actively engage in dialogue with local NGOs, Government bodies and professional institutions, to further the goals and transparency of the SEA programme.                                     Essential Duties & Responsibilities:                                     Carry out special projects, as designated by the Line Manager, which utilise areas of technical expertise.                                   Management Skills                                   Approachability -           is easy to approach and talk to; spends the extra effort to put others at ease; can be warm, pleasant and gracious; is sensitive to and patient with the interpersonal anxieties of others; builds rapport well; is a good listener; is an early knower, getting informal and incomplete information in time to do something about it.                                   Functional / technical skills -           Has the functional and technical knowledge and skills to do the job at a high level of accomplishment.                                   Integrity and trust -           is widely trusted; is seen as a direct, truthful individual; can present the unvarnished truth in an appropriate and helpful manner; keeps confidences; admits mistakes; doesn t misrepresent him/herself for personal gain.                                   Priority setting           - spends his/her time and the time of others on what s important; quickly zeros in on the critical few and puts the trivial many aside; can quickly sense what will help or hinder accomplishing a goal; eliminates roadblocks; creates focus.                                   Negotiating -           The ability to skilfully negotiate in tough situations with both internal and external groups. Can win concessions without damaging relationships, can be both directed and forceful as well as diplomatic.                                   Academics & Training Background                                      University Degree in Engineering, Occupational Health & Safety, Human Resource Management, Law or related Fields.                                      At least 10 years of progressive experience in manufacturing industry with focus on compliance, with at least six years experience in the area of social compliance .                                  Written Communication - is able to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of styles; can get messages across that have the desired effect.                             Language Knowledge of local language and dialects in country of operation. Fluent written and spoken English.                              Presentation Skills - Effectiveness in a variety of formal presentations, one-on-one, small and large groups, with peers, direct reports and senior management; is effective both inside and outside the organisation such as NGO and local governments, on hard data and controversial topics; commands attention and can manage group process during the presentation.                             Government Dialogue, able to represent the company in dialogue with government of occupational health & safety, environmental pollution, labour rights, human rights, as and where appropriate.                                  Communication/Customer Contact                                     Interactions Internally:                                 All levels of adidas Sourcing departments and within SEA departments.                                 Interactions Externally:                                  Business partners senior management, business partners workforces.                             Stakeholders, such as interest groups, non governmental organisations (NGO) and relevant government departments.                              Professional Associations                                  Professional Experience                                 Several years of regional experience in a related field, the incumbent must be able to contribute to the team at an expert level, to supplement the SEA team existing range expertise.                              Familiar with industry trends and relevant standards in occupational health, safety and environment and employment                              Preferable be a professional member of reputable professional institutions, or to obtain such membership.                                 Further Requirement                                The job requires hands on experience in the field and provides advice to business partners.                          Frequent travel to both local and international is essential, and is expected to work in industrial environment.                         Able to trouble shoot issues, identify risks, manage crises and recommend and support senior management with emergency situations.                      COURAGE:    Speak up when you see an opportunity; step up when you see a need..       OWNERSHIP:    Pick up the ball. Be proactive, take responsibility and follow-through.       INNOVATION:    Elevate to win. Be curious, test and learn new and better ways of doing things.       TEAMPLAY:    Win together. Work collaboratively and cultivate a shared mindset.       INTEGRITY:    Play by the rules. Hold yourself and others accountable to our company s standards.       RESPECT:    Value all players. Display empathy, be inclusive and show dignity to all

column2: Job title: WFM Manager Department  Workforce Management Location  Gurgaon / Pune Description: People are what drive Fareportal. We are one of the fastest growing travel technology companies in the world; our portfolio of travel brands, including flagship product CheapOair, receives over 100 million visitors annually.  Fareportal offers a plethora of travel products such as Booking Engines for flight, cars, hotels, vacations, events and activities and mobile apps. We use the latest, cutting edge technologies to produce one of the fastest loading and high converting travel websites.   There isnt a better time to join our growing global team! To ensure strategic goals are met through, collaborative planning, effective communication, stakeholder management, cross functional working, while ensuring forecast alignment with strategic goals. with recruitment for hiring plans  Review forecasting with the Scheduling & RTA team  Overall governance of the WFM  systems & processes   Manage operations from scheduling & real time perspective efficiencies for the Contact Center  People management, review & development for his / her immediate team Knowledge, skills & competencies required:  Functional knowledge of workforce management tools  Overall Understanding of the Workforce Management, along with operational management  Good knowledge of MS Office  Understands and has knowledge of key Contact Centre metrics such as shrinkage, AHT, Occupancy, schedule adherence, etc  Analyse situations, identifies the gaps quickly and take necessary steps to avoid impact on Service Levels  Ability to make / take decisions (could be unpopular / difficult) impacting strategic outcomes appropriately and effectively  Consistently demonstrates organization orientation and detail orientation ??Plans and organizes large-scale and long-term Minimum 12~14 years??experience in Contact Centre Industry   Minimum of 10~12 years??experience in Workforce Management Disclaimer This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. column2: About the Role:   ?   As a Group Manager in our Jobs Acquisition team, you'll play a pivotal role in ensuring?Naukri.com remains the go-to destination for both job seekers and recruiters. You'll be responsible for driving the acquisition of new jobs from our billed clients, utilizing their job credits effectively, and maintaining a diverse and attractive job pool on the platform. This is a results-oriented position where your success will be directly tied to the growth and engagement of our user base.   ?   What you'll do:   ?     Lead a team of Acquisition Specialists, providing coaching, mentorship, and guidance for optimal performance.   Develop and implement strategies to increase the number of jobs acquired from billed clients, exceeding set targets and objectives.   Identify and capitalize on new opportunities for jobs acquisition, leveraging your strong business acumen and understanding of the recruitment landscape.   Proactively analyze data and trends to refine acquisition strategies, optimize job credit utilization, and ensure a robust job count across diverse industries and sectors.   Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Client Relationship Management, and Product teams to drive seamless client experiences and platform improvements.   Champion innovative thinking and process improvements, constantly seeking new ways to optimize jobs acquisition and platform effectiveness.   Foster a positive and results-oriented team culture, fostering open communication and continuous learning.     ?   Who you are:   ?     You have 5+ years of experience in a fast-paced environment, ideally within acquisition, sales, or operations within the recruitment or related industry.   You possess a proven track record of exceeding targets and driving tangible results through strategic initiatives.   You have strong leadership and team management skills, able to motivate and inspire your team to achieve their best.   You are a data-driven individual with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.   You are a strategic thinker with a knack for identifying and implementing innovative solutions.   You are an excellent communicator with strong interpersonal and collaboration skills.   You are highly organized and possess impeccable time management skills.              ?          Roles and Responsibilities   The role of a Senior Manager of Operations is a crucial one in any organization. This position involves overseeing and managing the day-to-day activities and operations of a business to ensure smooth and efficient functioning. The responsibilities of a Senior Manager of Operations are diverse and require a strong understanding of all aspects of the business. Let's explore the roles and responsibilities of this key position:    1. Strategic Planning: A Senior Manager of Operations is responsible for developing and implementing strategic plans to ensure the overall success and growth of the business. This involves setting clear objectives, identifying key performance indicators, and creating action plans to achieve goals.    2. Team Leadership: As a Senior Manager of Operations, you will be responsible for leading and managing a team of operations staff. This includes hiring, training, and supervising employees, as well as providing guidance and support to ensure a high level of performance and productivity.    3. Process Improvement: It is the responsibility of the Senior Manager of Operations to identify areas for improvement within the business operations and implement strategies to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and maximize productivity.    4. Quality Control: Ensuring high-quality products and services is a key responsibility of a Senior Manager of Operations. This involves implementing quality control measures, monitoring production processes, and addressing any issues that may affect the quality of products or services.    5. Communication and Collaboration: Senior Managers of Operations play a crucial role in fostering effective communication and collaboration within the organization. This includes liaising with other departments, addressing concerns or conflicts, and ensuring that all teams are working together towards common goals.    8. Compliance and Regulations: It is essential for Senior Managers of Operations to stay abreast of industry regulations and ensure that the business operations are in compliance with all applicable laws and standards.    In conclusion, the role of a Senior Manager of Operations is multifaceted and requires a diverse skill set. This position is vital for the smooth and efficient functioning of an organization, and the responsibilities outlined above are essential for the successful performance of this role.

Providing forecasts to terminals and vessel planners on cargo set to sail.          Preparing, coordinating and supervising transshipment activities.          Making sure vessels are loaded and unloaded in a timely fashion.          Being the initial point of contact for claims, notifying the proper parties of damaged equipment/cargo and      arranging for surveys to be conducted.          Preparing hazardous manifests and collecting hazardous dock receipts; hazardous dock receipts are combined with the information contained within the booking          Providing Terminal Departure Report to vessel planners after vessel sailing.          Maintaining all vessel arrival and departure information as required.          Validating invoices for storage, reefer monitoring and various terminal costs          Reconciling cargo booked for vessels at cut off dates to avoid imbalances at the terminal.          Arranging and providing cost estimates for special shipments (ie: out-of-gauge, stowage, lashing, securing)          Solving terminal booking problems, updating systems and assisting customers and drivers with issues.            Qualifications and Technical Job Requirements:            12 years industry experience in Shipping industry and Port Terminal Operations          Multiple port and terminal / planning experience and knowledge of customs process            Solid understanding of Vessel, Port, Terminal, Transport (Feeder, Rail, Truck), Equipment MR functions.            Familiar with depot / CFS operations including reefer containers            Sharp Focus on Cost management            Vendor management experience preferred.            Ability to take initiative and resolve complex issues.            Time management and work planning skills.              Business Systems/IT                Good knowledge of user application systems (FIS, MS Office, Word, Excel)            Knowledge of user applications systems (FIS, COMPASS (If applicable))            Process knowledge systems support optimization            Ops process and system reengineering            Awareness of data quality importance, steering, etc            Ability to promptly process data and request under pressure            Understanding of data quality benchmarking and management

column2: Education :    PhD in Agri science from tier-1 institutes (IISc, ICAR etc in India and others abroad)       Required Skills Experience :         10-15 years of work experience in Agri business with practical experience of managing multiple farms         Proven track record of delivering best-in-class farm output and yields         Experience of working with multiple teams         Awareness of Indian Agri landscape soils, crops, weather etc.         Comfortable with travelling across farm sites           Primary Objectives of Position:    Looking for a senior leader in the role of Farm Ops Excellence Lead to build out a Centre of Excellence in Farm Operations across multiple sites and collaborate with business unit teams to run the farms in the most efficient method       Job Profile :         The candidate will be part of a fast-paced start-up like team and will have the chance to create best-in-class farm management practices         Work closely with the RD lead and Agri Business unit head         The business aspirations are to create a 500+Cr company with a global footprint within the first 2-3 years of operations and will require an entrepreneurial and dynamic leadership team to take on the mandate for the business build.       Key Accountabilities:       Planning Strategy:          Prepare a detailed annual crop calendar for each land parcel under management, in line with the annual business strategic and operating plans         Prepare POP (Package of Practices) containing crop calendars, plan for plant upkeep etc. for all land parcels         Oversee farm operations planning in line with best-in-class farm management practices         Prepare roadmap for implementing latest technological developments on farms         Forecast yield of each crop to support PL planning for each business unit         Achieve target operating metrics:         Monitor on-field operations and compare the same against the plans         Identify the best practices and gaps and revise plans based on benchmarks across site locations         Codify learnings and translate them into actionable insights for field operations teams         Support in commercial deployment of RD of compelling technological solutions that optimize costs and yields         Knowledge sharing:         Oversee training of farm teams on the latest developments agronomical practices, technological advances, etc. to ensure best-in-class farm management         Work with various agriculture research agencies (companies, universities etc.) and vendors of new age Agri technologies to explore adopt best-in-class farm management practices         Collaborate across team:         Understand requirements of business and work with RD to operationally think through the best practices and methods to achieve yield, cost, results         Ensure farm practices are being consistently adhered to across sites         Advise and collaborate with business unit teams to implement planned farm activities

column2: CMS Info Systems is looking for Branch Manager at  Kozhikode   About CMS Info Systems: CMS is Indias largest Cash Management and Payment Solutions firm, and the worlds fourth largest ATM Cash Management company. With a network spanning over 100,000 ATMs and retail outlets, CMS is uniquely positioned as the company that literally serves as the 'circulation system' of the country's economy. Clients include all the leading banks in the country, along with financial institutions and top retail chains . If interested please share cvs at  daminee.rane@cms.com    Responsible for supervising and managing branch operations, branch growth and revenue, improving overall operational and departmental efficiencies.  We are looking for candidates from Ecommerce / Courier logistics industry   Check and verify end to end daily operation records, handle questions or concerns of operational shortages or overages and address problems with concern authority. Organize to service each business division while maintaining and improving overall operational and departmental efficiencies. Interface cross-functionally at all levels within the divisions of the company, including communication with employees, management, external resources and concerns, such as bank, MSP, local police and governmental agencies. Ensure proper compliance and adherence to all appropriate SOP Participates on departmental teams and provides direct support to the department. Oversee day-to-day operations of ATM, CDP, CIT and manage the entire staffs of your Area Effect necessary communication and motivation to staff. Monitors individual performance via observation and review of various productivity metrics. Counsels and disciplines as necessary. Act as logistics facilitator to ensure that all elements of the operation process are coordinated to meet customer requirements in a timely and high quality Improve operational efficiencies to increase ability to process customer deliverable using both systems and physical improvements
