column2: Work Location-Goa(only) Job Overview: The Jewellery Online Operations Manager is responsible for overseeing and managing the online operations of the company's e-commerce platform. This role ensures seamless online shopping experiences, efficient inventory management, and effective data entry, contributing to the overall growth and success of the online store. Key Responsibilities: 1.	Website Management: Oversee the daily operations of the e-commerce website. Ensure the website is user-friendly, visually appealing, and fully functional. Collaborate with web developers to implement updates, enhancements, and troubleshoot technical issues. Monitor website performance, including uptime, speed, and customer feedback. 2.	Inventory Management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date product listings with detailed descriptions, pricing, and images. Implement inventory control procedures to prevent stockouts and overstock situations. Conduct regular inventory audits and reconcile any discrepancies. Coordinate with suppliers and manage the ordering process. Ensure real-time synchronization between online and offline inventory. 3.	Data Entry and Accuracy: Perform and oversee data entry tasks related to product listings, inventory, sales, and customer information. Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data across all e-commerce platforms. Update product information promptly in response to changes or new product arrivals. 4.	Customer Service and Order Fulfillment: Maintain high standards of online customer service and support. Handle customer inquiries, feedback, and complaints efficiently and effectively. Oversee the order fulfillment process to ensure timely and accurate deliveries. Coordinate with logistics and warehouse teams to streamline operations. 5.	Sales and Marketing Support: Monitor and analyze online sales performance and develop strategies to meet sales targets. Generate and analyze sales reports to provide insights to upper management. Collaborate with the marketing team to implement digital marketing campaigns, promotions, and SEO strategies. Assist in the development and execution of digital marketing content. 6.	Financial Management: Manage the e-commerce budget and control operational expenses. Ensure accurate and timely processing of online transactions and financial records. Prepare and present financial reports to upper management. 7.	Compliance and Security: Ensure compliance with company policies and e-commerce regulations. Implement and enforce security measures to protect customer data and inventory. Conduct regular security audits and address any identified vulnerabilities. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Business Administration, E-Commerce, Retail Management, or a related field. column2: About NCR Atleos                                                                                      NCR Atleos,  headquartered in Atlanta,  is a leader in expanding financial access.  Our dedicated 20, 000 employees optimize the branch,  improve operational efficiency and maximize self-service availability for financial institutions and retailers across the globe.           Change Manager        Position Summary        As the IT Change Manager,  you will be responsible for oversight of the Change Management process.   If you have an obsessive focus on change management process & procedure,  service levels,  standardizing processes,  meaningful metrics,  insightful risk mitigation and enjoy driving continuous improvements,  then this is the right opportunity for you.              The IT Change Manager will be responsible for working closely with IT teams to ensure changes are properly documented,  planned,  and implemented.   This role requires Change Management knowledge,  creating project plans,  developing processes,  coordinating,  and driving execution,  and communicating to senior leaders on status,  risks,  and process/communication   changes.  Cross-team coordination,  project management,  executive presentation skills,  and written communication skills are essential.            Role and Responsibilities          Support and refine the established ITIL Change Management practice across the organization to serve and support the successful delivery of technology-based IT change initiatives.         Lead the application of a structured methodology for Change Management activities through review of submitted changes and continual reinforcement of requirements for Changes.         Drive the Change Management process to ensure change requests are submitted properly,  reviewed,  and acted upon by the appropriate parties,  executed as scheduled upon approval,  and Change records are updated properly throughout the life cycle of the Change.          Create periodic reports about Change management and discuss key findings and opportunities with the IT Change owners.          Design and development of Change Management best practices for the organization,  including managing Change Advisory Board meetings.         Drive steady state and continuous improvement in the ITSM operations support of the organization .         Schedule and lead the Change Advisory Board (CAB) meetings to perform impact analysis to minimize risk and disruption to the changes made in the production environment.          Maintain IT change documentation including the Policy,  Standard,  Procedure,  Training and User Documentation.         Conduct trend analysis to identify potential points of service failure,  launching service improvement actions that provide solutions to the perceived exposure.          Define Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and measure success metrics and monitor change progress.  Perform assessments of change success and change adoption and develop strategies to address challenges,  risks,  or gaps.            Skill Requirements/Preferences       Advanced understanding of Change Management processes and proven application of change management principles.          Experienced Change Management professional with proven success leading or managing organizational change management activities on a high-complexity,  program-wide change.          Ability to adapt to evolving priorities.          General understanding of IT services including Application development,  Network infrastructure,  Hosting and Cloud Platform.          Excellent active listening skills.          Experience using Service Now,  JIRA or equivalent ticket management tools.          Established Project management experience.          Proficient in Microsoft Office 365 applications especially in Word,  Excel,  PowerPoint and Outlook.         Experience in working in a Service Delivery role in a Business-Critical environment.  Must have a business/ end user focus with a technical background.        Excellent interpersonal skills,  as well as excellent communication skills,  verbal and written to both technical and non-technical audiences that are in a geographically dispersed environment.       Experience negotiating effectively and facilitating conflict resolution.          Experience building and maintaining relationships within the Technology and Business organizations.          Fluent in English verbal and written.                     Some of the soft skills / abilities required for you to be successful in this role include:            ITIL certification       Critical Thinking,  Problem Solving and Deductive Reasoning.     Active Listening.     Great Team Player Characteristics.     Maintaining a professional demeanor and attitude to  control the chaos .     Ability and confidence to act decisively and take constructive feedback onboard.     Exercise influence over a wide variety of individuals at all levels of technical & business leadership.     Ability to multi-task and make good judgments in a dynamic and high impact environment.     Excellent phone / video presence and verbal / written communication skills.     Strong relationship management and client centric mindset.       Working experience and knowledge of end-to-end IT software and systems solution delivery from idea conception,  design,  development and transition into production operations and maintenance         Experience including software development,  databases,  Unix systems administration,  and cloud-based application management          Education Requirements     Bachelor s degree in Computer Science or related field and a minimum of 4 years of demonstrated in ITSM Change Management and/or information technology.   Or any equivalent combination of experience training,  and/or education.     3+ years of work experience      Offers of employment are conditional upon passage of screening criteria applicable to the job.                                                                                           EEO Statement                                                                                    NCR Atleos is an equal-opportunity employer.  It is NCR Atleos policy to hire,  train,  promote,  and pay associates based on their job-related qualifications,  ability,  and performance,  without regard to race,  color,  creed,  religion,  national origin,  citizenship status,  sex,  sexual orientation,  gender identity/expression,  pregnancy,  marital status,  age,  mental or physical disability,  genetic information,  medical condition,  military or veteran status,  or any other factor protected by law. Maintain staff discipline and professionalism. Ensure business targets of conversion and counselling are met, keep a strong vigil on revenue leakage. Manage donor agencies, surrogacy agencies, regulatory compliance of the centre. column2: 1) Keeping track of invoices/bills:    In order to provide customers credit to purchase your product or service, and to keep record of the purchase, you will need to send customers an invoice. This should have the details of the good or service being sold, the date of purchase, the payable amount, and the timeframe within which your customer has to pay.       2) Setting reminders:    Setting reminders for your customer to make payments, and for yourself to pay you bills is crucial to making sure no payment is overdue. Piled up AR or AP is never an indicator of a smoothly running business. The longer it takes to make the payment, the longer your accounts receivable stays open, the less chance you have of getting paid.       3) Making/Receiving payments:    Making transactions is the crux of your business. Paying your bills and collecting payments from customers is how your business runs. This requires you to have a grasp of your finances, and see who owes you money and whom you owe money to.       4) Updating accounts:    Just as crucial is making sure to record all payments due or received in your accounts. This ensures you have a clear idea of your cash flow.   Simplify AR and AP process with an online accounting software    Both AR and AP are important aspects of your business functioning. Managing them however can be a bit of a hassle. Investing in an online accounting system can help with several processes involved with your AR and AP, including:       1) Invoices and bills:    Managing all your bills and invoices can be difficult. Keeping track of your invoices and bills is simpler when it s all in one convenient location. You can send invoices or record bills for every transaction you make, and schedule them to be sent automatically on a later date.       2) Reminders:    It s easy for your customer to forget about a pending payment, just as easy it is for you to forget a payment you owe to a vendor. With an accounting system, you can send reminders to your customers, as well as set reminders for yourself when it is time to pay.       3) Payments:    Most accounting systems integrate with several payment service providers to ensure you give your customer the benefit of choosing whichever payment method they prefer. This can prove to be very important when it comes to ensuring payments are made on time, every time.       4) Reports:    Several accounting systems give you access to automatically generated financial reports for all the transactions going in and out of your business.This helps you have an overall understanding of how your business is doing, and can help make some important decisions.
column11: Accounting system, Financial reporting, Billing, Cash flow, Management, Accounting software, Accounts receivable, Investment

This includes managing and coordinating various processes, ensuring the efficient and effective functioning of departments, and ensuring that company policies and procedures are followed.      Key responsibilities may include:        Developing and implementing operational strategies      Managing and supervising a team of employees      Analyzing and improving processes to increase efficiency and productivity      Identifying and resolving operational problems and issues.        The ideal candidate for this role should have strong leadership skills, excellent communication and interpersonal skills, experience in managing teams, and a deep understanding of operations and business processes
column11: Interpersonal skills, Process improvement, Management, Operations, Supervision

column2: Create and maintain financial, cashflow, sales and staffing models.     Work closely with the Partners to ensure that they have the right information based on models to make decisions.     Alert Partners well in advance when models indicate unexpected cash, cashflow, sales or staffing situations in the future. Internal customer experience - employees (internal customers) should have a butter smooth experience with salaries, timesheets, expenses, facilities, meals, perks, etc.     Covering the above will require management of: Accounts, Invoicing and Administration of the office. column2: Assist SBU Head in preparing financial budgets and budgets for manpower, capital and operations expenditure.   Ensure inspection operations are further enhanced as per SGS policy and client requirements.   Monitor scheduling of inspections and ensure execution is done as per client s SOP with available resources.   Maintain high LC by continuously monitoring expense against revenue.   Maintain daily activities of staff and other resources to optimize expenses and profitability.   Assist in developing existing and new business through regular client contacts and satisfaction.   Monitor performance and investigate any problems/complaints with a view to improvement of operations to zero defect as the ultimate goal.   Act as interface between client and execution team. Work closely with SGS overseas offices.   Communicate and coordinate with clients and handle their claims and complaints.   Maintain quality level in department and ensure key performance indicators are strictly followed.   Maintain standards and technical capabilities to meet and satisfy demands set by the clients and / or any statutory authorities.   Approve certificates, reports and invoices, as required within specified timeframe.   Co-ordinate with customer for analysis of complaints, prepare investigation reports and follow up of short term and long-term corrective action.   Draft, negotiate and secure contracts for local and international clients   Manage pre and post contract commercial issues, including credit and collection   Manage operations to ensure adequate efficiency, productivity and the best quality of execution   Ensure timely and accurate reporting to customers   Responsible for handling the complaints in coordination with the location Manager and Quality Manager.   Collect data on training needs; identify suitable programs, coordinating with technical auditors for nominating candidates from the team.   Lead, coach and develop branch inspection team.   Apply discipline and grievance procedure according to the company s policies and guidelines.   Managerial review of quality documents, files, invoices, capability matrix and job execution matrix.   Undertake other assignments as identified by the NQM towards ensuring delivery of inspections services according to quality procedures and/or compliant with accreditation requirements. Desirable   : Experienced in Production & Quality control           Specialization   : Experience in Operations majorly with added experience in Business development with Good communication skills           Additional Information         Minimum Years: 8 years Maximum Years: 10 years           Industry/ Sector   : Garment / Textiles           Scope of job /Activities handled   : Operations majorly with some knowhow on Business Development

column2: A. Team                   The AOM ensures all team members:       Have a thorough understanding of the company s expectations and standards regarding customer service     Reach and maintain these high standards of customer care daily     Are courteous and willing to help all customers always     Respond to customer enquiries/ complaints quickly and calmly as per company procedure     Are efficient and have an in-depth knowledge of the product in their department     Dress in full uniform as per company guidelines, clean and tidy     Are positioned in the shops to maximize service     Manage brand ambassadors and promoters and ensure their understanding of standards and expectations     Effect a smooth shift change procedure, minimizing disruption to customer service     Have good timekeeping and attendance     Are made aware of all promotional activity, special offers and new product listings                 B. Shop       The AOM ensures:       The sales floor is clean and clear of obstacles always     The gondolas are clean and dust free throughout     Merchandise is clean and dust free and well presented     All ticketing and promotional signage is correct and clearly displayed     Any maintenance requirements are communicated immediately through correct channels     Control the efficient opening and operational times of our satellite shops             C. Merchandise       The AOM ensures       All products are clean, in perfect condition and properly displayed     Adequate stocks are on display     Stock rotation rules are applied     All ticketing and pricing are visible and complies with company policy     All signage is clear, relevant, and attractive to the eye     Promotional signage is highly visible and in the correct place     Promotional gondolas are well stocked for maximum impact             D. Cash Register Responsibilities       The AOM ensures:       Adequate cash registers are operational always     Cash registers are manned by fully trained and alert cashiers     Correct signage is displayed at cash points always     Security procedures are adhered to always     Floats are issued in a safe and controlled manner and reach the cash desks in a safe and controlled manner     Cashiers use the security measures available always, note checkers, CC approval checks etc     Cashiers ask for the boarding passes at every transaction and enter destination correctly     Cashiers regularly check register transactions for accuracy, product description, price etc     POS cards are used by the named holder only and secure always     Adequate change is available to all cash desks always     Change is counted and agreed by both SM and Cashier     Any breach of company rules or misuse of the cash register is reported to the SFM immediately     Any malfunction of cash register or Verifone equipment is reported to IT immediately and logged in the daily report     To record any missing flight information etc in the daily IT report     Cash desk area is clean and clear always and well stocked with packing materials     No personal belongings are kept at the cash desks             E. Stock Control Responsibilities       The AOM ensures:       All personnel are always alert to the possibility that goods will be stolen!     Good staff coverage in their area always with customers being acknowledged     All retail personnel check stock prices, shelf labels promotional signage etc to ensure accuracy.     Security tags, seals etc are in place on all relevant stocks     Security tags etc are removed safely at point of sale     Regular checks are done on stocks with expiry dates reporting immediately any concerns     Personnel handle all company stocks and assets carefully thereby avoiding damaged stocks     All goods are received into the dept according to correct procedure and assist Merchandisers by carrying out spot checks on transfers     No stocks are removed from the dept without the correct transfer paperwork     Cashiers scan all goods into the register for every transaction     Control over manually entering a PLU and ensures accuracy always             F. Personnel Responsibilities         To create and maintain a positive team atmosphere geared to achieving sales goals     To manage and motivate the team to maximum efficiency     To constantly assess team members performance and give relevant feedback     To understand team members strengths and weaknesses and identify best person for each task     Communicate clearly to the team and delegate fairly throughout the team     To always praise in public and discuss disciplinary issues in private     To keep any disciplinary issues under control and in perspective     To communicate immediately with SFM and personnel issues that cannot be resolved easily at team level     To monitor grooming and personal hygiene standards and ensure the uniform is worn correctly always     Assign breaks equally and fairly in line with the flight schedule     Record all absence and lateness of team members in the daily HR report     Monitor the leave balances of team members     To partake in staff appraisals             G. Administration Responsibilities         To ensure all documentation relating to issues within your team and dept are completed correctly and within the required timeframe as per company procedure. Leave forms, sickness forms etc             H. Management responsibilities         To lead the team by example in all aspects of the job and personal appearance     To attend and take an active part in all monthly retail meetings     To be sales driven and competitive leading the team to achieve goals as set by the company     To exercise highest level of confidentiality regarding company documentation, information, and statistics     Develop and maintain positive working relationships and communications with team members, colleagues, and management     To assess performance of yourself and make improvements where necessary. To communicate with RM any areas of concern or training requirements       Skills       customer query resolution     Sales     brands     CUSTOMER SERVICE     operations     team handling

column2: The Senior Operations Manager / Country Operations Manager / Operations Director is the leadership and operational interface and is accountable to maximize alignment and productivity of the operations (under remit) to maximize gross margin        This role will oversee safety, quality, and operational execution to ensure compliance with all company systems and customer expectations      This role may play the focal point lead within a country ( Country Operations Manager )                         Roles & Responsibilities                  SAFETY, SECURITY & COMPLIANCE            Maintains the highest standards of corporate governance, ensuring that all activities are carried out ethically and in compliance with Company s Security, Compliance & HSE policies, Management System, relevant laws, regulations, standards, and industry practices and complies with the Company s Rules to Live By          Places Quality, Health & Safety, Security, and protection of the Environment as core values while never intentionally placing employees, our processes, customers, or the communities in which we live and work at risk.          Seeks continual improvement in Health, Safety, Security & protection of the Environment, considering responsible care, process vulnerabilities, public, customer and employee inputs, knowledge and technology and best business practices to exceed customer expectations.          Demonstrate effective safety leadership for the health and safety arrangements of all subordinates and for any persons visiting them while on the Company premises.          In case of concerns with safety, quality non-conformances, or integrity concerns, exercises Stop Work Authority to suspend operations.          Monitor performance trends across the remit, to identify corrective and proactive interventions.          Share knowledge across the operations to ensure best practice HSE management.                    QUALITY            Responsible for being familiar with the Companys Quality policies and taking an active role in the compliance and improvement of Weatherford s Quality Management System          Maintains service quality as an immediate priority when working across all areas of the business and continually seeks areas for improvement.          Coordinate with the Quality function to maintain, communicate, and implement Quality Management System (QMS) in operations locations.          Monitor performance trends across the remit, to identify corrective and proactive interventions.          Share knowledge across the operations to ensure best practice quality management.                    OPERATIONS            Job planning and delivery oversight and ensure systems of monitoring and improvement exist across the operations under remit.          Support PL contract handover from sales and ensure the systems and competence exist to mitigate risks, contract leakage and exploit opportunities in the contract.          Take a more active role in contract handover from sales for critical / non-routine work.          Facilitate the support functions to deliver key services and support to enable efficient operations.          Play an escalation point role for operational issues/activities.          Execute labor productivity measures to maximize gross margin and development opportunities for personnel.          Support external revenue & direct cost forecasting & accruals.          For Country Operations Manager, ensure the effective operation of bases and facilities.          Oversee the execution of Tier 1 repair and maintenance and ensure R&M labor productivity efficiencies.          Identify cross-PL integration and efficiency opportunities.          Provide technical guidance to Sales as required.                    COMMUNICATION            Maintain effective communications with all key stakeholders both internal and where appropriate external.          Maintain strong customer relationships, identify customer needs, and ensure alignment with sales on pricing for all bids and quotes; offer solutions, set and manage budgets, and ensure quality of job delivery.          Leverage market intelligence and liaise with account managers, operations, technical sales and global product line leaders to forecast activity trends and maximize financial results (including profit and loss, fixed assets, inventory, capital expenditures and receivables)          Relationship development with local authorities                    FINANCIAL & PERFORMANCE            Responsible for the Gross Margin of the consolidation of operations under remit.          Financial trend analysis and initiation of actions to improve the cash position of the company.          Maximizing financial results of the assigned PLs, including forecast, profit and loss, fixed assets, inventory, capital expenditures, payables, and receivables          Costs incurred should be within the approved budget and processed within agreed time frames and following the relevant financial policy and procedure.                    PEOPLE & DEVELOPMENT            Oversee and champion the career progression of field and workshop employees.          Ensure the Operations Managers have the necessary resources to execute planned work.          Drive multi-skill competency development to maximize gross margin and development opportunities for personnel.          Actively coach Operations Managers across all disciplines of the role.          Lead the way in people management to drive a motivated disciplined and productive workforce. This includes effective staff leadership, performance management by setting objectives and driving appraisals and communication.                    VISION & LEADERSHIP            Influence the geographic strategy in collaboration with Senior Managers.          Ensures all applicable components of the strategy are developed and fully executed across the geographical area.          Ensuring a One Weatherford culture              Qualifications            Experience & Education                      REQUIRED            Bachelor s degree in engineering, or related field from an accredited University (or diploma/certificate with relevant work experience)          8-10 years experience in an Engineering, Service Delivery, or related functional role.                    PREFERRED            10+ years experience or more in a leadership position driving influence cross functionally                    Knowledge, Skills & Abilities                      REQUIRED            Experience in the execution of day-to-day operations and product related projects          Knowledge of finance, accounting, budgeting, and cost control principles including Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)          Strong organizational and effective communication skills          Familiarity with reading, analyzing, and interpreting common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents.          Work requires professional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to communicate and interact with officials at all levels of government and clients. Work effectively across a diverse multicultural multilingual community.                    PREFERRED            Experience of project delivery & implementation          Experience of Oil and Gas surface systems, down-hole tools & applications
column11: People development, Performance management, Fixed assets, Trend analysis, Market intelligence, GAAP, Project delivery, Forecasting, Service quality, Operations

column2: What will you do          Technical Support and Troubleshooting:    Utilize extensive domain knowledge in Video technologies to provide hands-on support for the operation of OTT Headend. Analyze and troubleshoot issues using specialized tools to ensure 24x7 operational success. Offer technical support for various live events, demonstrating proficiency in Play-out system operations       AWS Media Services and Technologies   : Apply hands-on experience with AWS media services related to Live & VOD, ensuring efficient utilization and troubleshooting. Display adeptness in media streaming technologies such as RTMP, SS, HDS, HLS, MPEG-Dash, encoding technologies, and streaming codecs       Codec and Architecture:    Manage and understand video and audio codecs ( H.264 , H.265 , MPEG4, AAC), streaming architectures (RTP/UDP, RTSP, HTTP, RTMP), SCTE35/104 markers, and Native DRM for encrypted playback       Middleware Platforms and Network Delivery:    Work with middleware platforms, enabling seamless interaction between client applications and back-end systems. Facilitate video delivery through leading content distribution networks, ensuring reliable transmission and playback       Workflow Optimization and Technical Collaboration:    Enhance production workflows by identifying, troubleshooting, and resolving issues between transcoding, publishing, playback, and syndication systems. Act as a technical resource across departments, providing expertise to address and resolve technical challenges effectively       Utilization of Technical Tools and Communication:    Employ Hardware/Software Encoders, Playout software, Ingest tools, TS analyzer, Multi-viewers, and Customized CMS for optimal operations. Leverage strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to articulate technical information and actively engage in problem-solving scenarios       Networking:    Apply basic networking knowledge encompassing TCP/IP, UDP/IP, IGMP, CBR/VBR Streaming, DHCP, DNS, and LAN/WAN technologies to support video delivery systems               Who should apply for this role          Education:    The ideal candidate should possess a relevant Graduate or Post-Graduate degree        Experience:    Candidates with a minimum of 8 years of experience in the Telecom/Video industry, showcasing expertise in video technologies, streaming protocols, and troubleshooting tools       Technical Specialists:    Individuals experienced in providing hands-on technical support for OTT Headend operations, live events, and Play-out system functionalities. Candidates proficient in utilizing AWS media services for Live & VOD applications, with a strong grasp of media streaming technologies. Those with comprehensive knowledge of video and audio codecs, streaming architectures, DRM technologies, and markers like SCTE35/104, ensuring secure playback. Individuals possessing a foundational understanding of networking components and services, enabling support for video delivery systems       Middleware Platform Professionals:    Individuals familiar with middleware platforms facilitating interactions between client applications and back-end systems, particularly within content delivery networks       Workflow Optimization Specialists:    Professionals adept at analyzing and improving production workflows involving transcoding, publishing, playback, and syndication systems       Communication-Savvy:    Candidates with strong communication skills, capable of effectively conveying technical information and collaborating with cross-functional teams
column11: Telecom, LAN, CMS, DNS, HTTP, Middleware, Technical support, DHCP, Android

To achieve this a Hub Manager will be required to work with various stakeholders inside and outside the organisation. A healthy community at the hub will differentiate the best from the rest. Ability to have a laser sharp focus on member happiness and team development are key to be successful in this role. Overall Accountability: Hub Development: Community Development: Effective delivery of community program to make work better for hub members. Building & communicating the quarterly community plan for the hub. Ensure high quality in program identification and connections to enable member business growth. Driving high quality engagement programs that create a sense of belongingness for the member Partner with hub crew to timely solve for any other potential member problems/ needs. Marketing community programs to drive superior awareness and participation. Business Development:  Partner with Sales & Marketing team to deliver optimal hub occupancy level. Ensuring quality and accuracy of data in Sales CRM Solving for member expansion needs in partnership with sales team. Delivering Hub P&L Team Management: Working with Regional Manager to firm up recruitment plan to ensure business continuity. Mentoring the team on 91s purpose and values Hub Operations: Ensuring overall Invoice accuracy and timely issue resolution. Maintaining accurate hub MIS Ensuring Accounts receivable at hub level is in control. Ticketing Change management of policy communication etc. Monthly Budgeting Monthly P&L Monthly Hub Report Market Intelligence: Gather and keep oneself up to date with activities in the area around co working industry Skills Required: Ability to think and act decisively and make decisions when required.   Liaisoning with regulators and industry peers and keeping yourself abreast of emerging ML and fraud threats in the industry          Developing and implementing the fraud risk policy along with column2: We are an ALL WOMEN ENTERPRISE based in HIMACHAL PRADESH looking for an experienced WOMAN PRODUCTION MANAGER to organize and oversee the manufacturing of Jams, jellies, Marmalades and Chutneys. You will be ultimately responsible for the smooth running of all production lines and the quality of output. You will be working with an experienced team of women that has been in the producing Jams for the last 25 years.  We expect you to have deep know-how in production procedures documentation and coordination. Ability to direct personnel towards maximum performance will set you apart as a leader. Decision-making, Commumnication and problem-solving will take up a great part of your day. If you are up to it, wed like to talk to you. The goal is to ensure an efficient and productive manufacturing process that meets all our customer requirements. Some of the major responsibilities of your role as production manager are:  (1) Production planning  (2) Production control  (3) Quality control  (4) Method analysis and Reporting (5) Inventory control  Experience: We would like you to have a minimum 5 years experience as a Production Manager in the Food Industry Job Location : Rajgarh, Himachal Pradesh.  Daily travel : 2km from Rajgarh to the factories. Local bus is available.  Responsibilities of the job include: planning and      organising production schedules to fufill the PO requirement and plan for      buffer stock assessing PO, selecting,      ordering and purchasing materials in conversation with factory in-charge      and Head office. Maintaining,      Packing material and raw material based on average consumption reports estimating budgets      and timeline re-negotiating      timescales or schedules as necessary and Informing HO about the same ensuring that      health and safety regulations are met Ensuring that      SOP are maintained and followed Ensure output meets quality standards Report to Upper-management and HO, keep the channel of      communication open Ensuring duly      filled TRF documents, recipe records, weights and measures records, hygiene       reports, maintenance records,      rejection record, complaint file and action report.  determining      quality control standards.  overseeing      production processes organising the      repair and routine maintenance of production equipment supervising      and managing the work of junior staff Maintaining      Training Matrix, organising relevant training sessions. Training of a      Junior Production assistant Key skills for production managers Proven experience as production director Deep knowledge of production management Understanding of quality standards and health & safety regulations Knowledge of performance evaluation and budgeting concepts Experience in reporting on key production metrics Proficient in MS Office and ERP software Outstanding communication ability  Excellent organizational and leaderships skills Attention to detail Strong decision-making skills and a results-driven approach A team player Ability to handle the responsibility and pressure of meeting deadlines.

column2: Strategic Planning: Develop and implement operational strategies aligned with the company's objectives. Collaborate with senior management to define operational goals and objectives. Monitor industry trends and best practices to identify opportunities for operational enhancement. Team Leadership and Management: Provide leadership, guidance, and direction to the operations team. Build and maintain a high-performing team through effective recruitment, training, and development initiatives. Foster a culture of accountability, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the team. Process Optimization: Evaluate existing operational processes and systems to identify inefficiencies and areas for improvement. Develop and implement solutions to streamline workflows, reduce costs, and enhance productivity. Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of operational processes. Quality Assurance: Ensure adherence to quality standards and regulatory requirements across all operational activities. Implement quality control measures to minimize errors and defects. Conduct regular audits and inspections to monitor compliance and identify corrective actions. Supply Chain Management: Oversee inventory management, procurement, and logistics operations. Optimize supply chain processes to minimize lead times and reduce costs. Cultivate relationships with suppliers and vendors to ensure timely delivery of goods and services. Financial Management: Develop and manage the operations budget, ensuring optimal allocation of resources. Identify cost-saving opportunities and implement measures to improve cost-efficiency. Monitor financial performance against budgetary targets and implement corrective actions as needed. Risk Management: Identify operational risks and develop mitigation strategies to minimize potential disruptions. Establish contingency plans to address unforeseen challenges and emergencies. Monitor compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations.

column1: Assistant Manager- Group Conduct - Intelligence and Operations
column2: The role supports the Group Conduct Intelligence and Operations team in India and Dalian reports into the Manager in India     The Group Conduct Intelligence and Operations team is a part of General counsel shared services and is currently responsible for monitoring employee compliance with Fidelity s Group Personal Conflicts, Trading and Price Sensitive Information Policies ( the Policies )     It is also responsible for reporting breaches of these Policies as well as breaches of the Group s Code of Conduct to senior management and Fidelity's Boards                 About your role           The Group Conduct - Intelligence & Operations Assistant Manager will work closely with the Group Code of Conduct and Ethics teams to ensure all monitoring and reporting activities are carried out effectively.     Prepare various reporting for Intelligence and Operations team like board report, senior management reporting     Develop and regularly provide reports containing statistics from the personal trade monitoring system     Regular production of reports/ dashboards on a periodic basis with focus on quality and consistency of data     Regularly conduct monitoring of employee classification to ensure employees are classified according to the guidance issued. Where misclassification identified, liaise with HR and other relevant persons. Answer questions related to classification changes      Work with the different teams to streamline/ continuously improve existing process      Support the Intelligence and Operations team in India and Dalian with reviewing and addressing employee violations of the Personal Conflicts, Trading and Price Sensitive Information Policy. This entails seeking employee explanations for breaches identified, assisting with performing manual testing,     Support Intelligence & Operations team members with reaching out to employees in situations where duplicate reporting does not appear to be set up by employees.     Perform review the personal account dealing violation letters as per the code enforcement guidelines.     Provide information for DDQ (due diligence questioners) to difreent teams.     Support team members with other intelligence or monitoring activities carried out by the team and provide back-up coverage when needed.     Assist with providing information to Internal Audit or Compliance Monitoring when requested.     Develop and maintain procedures for the various activities conducted by this role.     Monitor the team s mailbox for any correspondence related to the activities carried out by the team and respond to all relevant correspondence.     Assist in tracking and coordination of key operational processes like RCSA                                                     Qualifications & Experience             At least 5-7 years overall experience preferably in Financial Service. Exposure to compliance and risk management is preferable     University (Bachelor) Degree preferably in Business, Finance, or a similar discipline     MBA or equivalent qualification (preferred, but not mandatory)     Knowledge of the various types of publicly traded securities would be an advantage                 Essential Skills             Excellent understanding of financial instruments.     Proven experience in timely and accurate delivery of senior management reports     Excellent written and verbal communication skills including superior report writing     High degree of proficiency in MS excel (strong knowledge of pivot tables, data sorting, filters, etc). Ability to develop macros, will be of advantage     Good degree of proficiency in MS Power Point including ability to develop clear, concise & compelling story lines for senior management     Analytical approach and problem-solving skills - ability to analyse data (qualitative & quantitative) and generate improvement hypotheses     Ability to work with stakeholders at all levels     Ability to multi-task and priorities workload with a strong attention to detail.     Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to work well in a team and on their own initiative.     Self-motivated with an eagerness to learn and a positive work ethic     Collaborative operating style with a focus on working together with others to achieve great outcomes for the business     Utmost level of professional conduct and ability to exercise discretion/maintain confidentiality.             Desirable Skills             Experience of the asset management industry would be an advantage     Experience based domain knowledge of General Counsel functions (Risk/ Compliance) would be an advantage     Flexible and adaptable, responds rapidly to changing agendas     Ability to use good judgement in the use of confidential information     Clear open communication with a willingness to learn & listen?
column11: General Counsel, Manager Internal Audit, Due diligence, Manual testing, Analytical, Asset management, Risk management, Macros, Operations

column2: Job Summary: The City Manager is a pivotal role responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of operations within a specific city or region. This role involves leadership, strategic planning, and effective management to ensure the city's overall success. The City Manager is responsible for driving growth, optimizing operational performance, maintaining compliance, and fostering strong relationships within the community. Core responsibilities include achieving Gross Merchandise Value (GMV), Contribution Margin (CM), and Working Capital (WC) targets, ensuring high On-Time-In-Full (OTIF) performance, and facilitating the excellence of all warehouses within the city. Responsibilities: * Lead and manage all operational aspects within the assigned city or region. * Develop and implement strategic plans to drive growth and meet GMV and CM targets while optimizing WC. * Optimize operational processes to enhance efficiency, productivity, and cost-effectiveness. * Collaborate with various departments, such as Business Finance,Corp Finance, Product,CDO, and HR, to ensure seamless operations. * Maintain compliance with company policies, industry regulations, and quality standards. * Foster strong relationships with local government, businesses, and community organizations to support the company's presence in the city. * Act as the primary point of contact for any city-specific issues or opportunities. * Continuously seek ways to improve the city's operational performance and customer satisfaction. * Develop and execute Sales and growth strategies to expand the company's presence in the city. * Monitor financial targets, performance metrics, and growth initiatives to ensure the city's success. * Provide guidance, training, and performance management for the city's team, fostering a culture of excellence. * Collaborate with internal teams to address customer inquiries, complaints, and service-related issues. * Stay informed about local trends and the competitive landscape to make informed business decisions. * Ensure that all warehouses within the city are operating at their best to meet OTIF targets. * Foster a culture of collaboration and excellence within the city's team. * Ensure that all warehouses within the city are operating at their best to meet OTIF targets. * Foster a culture of collaboration and excellence within the city's team. Requirements: * Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Management, Business Administration) or equivalent experience. * Proven experience in city or regional management, with a strong track record of leadership. * Strong leadership and team management skills. * Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities. * Effective communication and interpersonal skills for coordination with internal teams and external partners. * Problem-solving skills to address city-specific challenges and opportunities. * Adaptability to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
column11: City Manager, FMCG, sales growth, business finance, regional management, region, strategic planning

column2: What is this role all about? The primary objective of the Security & Loss Prevention (SLP) manager is to protect people, information, inventory and assets in designated areas of responsibility. SLP manager assists in proactively mitigating shrinkage and conducting investigations and audits in accordance with Zeptos Security guidelines and policies. The role involves cross-functional engagement and requires deep collaboration and influencing ability with stakeholders from business functions. This is a multisite field role and shall involve travelling to multiple sites within the AOR. The SLP manager along with LP Team will efficiently drive day-to-day loss prevention activities to ensure and maintain high quality and timely support to business Operations in their AOR. Responsibilities - What will you do? - Ensuring optimum functioning, serviceability and preventive maintenance of security systems and fire safety devices. Train Zepto and vendor employees in AOR on emergency response. - Perform risk assessment of sites in AOR & frame mitigation measures. - Ability to work on various tools & perform trend analysis to detect patterns indicating theft, fraud or abuse. - Ability to conduct detailed investigation within the policy framework, identify root cause  & write report, develop management action plan for process formulation/ compliance/ improvement. - Drive corrective and preventive process changes that could impact shrink reduction metrics positively. - Build effective working relationships within the team & stakeholders. - Effectively manage physical security of sites in AOR & security services vendors for SLA adherence and conduct training for LP team members. - BCP-Respond to crisis incidents & implement crisis management plan. - Coordinate with legal and Law enforcement agencies for further support based on investigation findings . Qualifications, Experience and Characteristics Required: - Minimum graduate with 3 years' experience in Loss prevention field, Asset protection, Investigations, Process compliance or Physical security preferably with experience from retail, e-Commerce, Warehouse and manufacturing industries. - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills - Adequate level of computer literacy including Proficiency in MS office package - Strong communication skills & fluent knowledge of verbal & written English. Knowledge of vernacular language. - Demonstrated ability to deal with business tools with critical thinking Demonstrated ability to perform in a pressure environment with adherence to timelines. - This role is a multisite role and it will require travel to sites within the AOR. - Strong interpersonal skills & proven experience in managing stakeholders and vendors - Strong business ethics, discretion.

column2: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Facility Operations Manager to oversee the efficient management and operation of multiple client facilities. As the Facility Operations Manager, you will be responsible for ensuring seamless daily operations, supervising maintenance tasks, managing staff, and maintaining excellent client relationships. Your primary objective will be to uphold our commitment to delivering top-notch facility services, meeting client expectations, and optimizing the overall operational performance of the facilities under your management.         Job Description             Roles & Responsibilities                   Facility Management:           Oversee the day-to-day operations of multiple client facilities, ensuring they operate smoothly and efficiently.     Implement and maintain best practices in facility management, including preventive maintenance, safety protocols, and emergency response procedures.     Coordinate with facility staff to ensure timely and effective resolution of facility-related issues.           Client Relationship Management:           Serve as the main point of contact for clients, cultivating strong professional relationships and addressing their facility-related needs.     Regularly liaise with clients to understand their requirements, gather feedback, and proactively address concerns to ensure client satisfaction.     Staff Supervision and Training:     Lead and mentor a team of facility management professionals.     Conduct regular performance evaluations, provide constructive feedback, and identify opportunities for staff development and training.           Budget and collection Management:           Develop and manage facility operation budgets, ensuring cost-effective practices and optimal resource allocation.     Identify areas for cost savings while maintaining service quality and compliance with industry standards.     Ensure monthly billing is completed for respective sites and keep a track of client payment and collections.           Business Development:           In addition to existing portfolio, expand the business footprint across city & region           Compliance and Safety:           Ensure facilities comply with all relevant regulations, safety standards, and industry guidelines.     Conduct routine inspections to assess facility conditions, identify potential hazards, and implement corrective actions.               Vendor Management:           Collaborate with external service providers and vendors, ensuring their performance aligns with agreed-upon service level agreements.     Evaluate vendor contracts and negotiate terms to secure favourable agreements for the company and clients.                     Experience & Qualifications:                   Bachelors degree in Facility Management, Business Administration, Hotel Management or B Tech- Electrical/ Mechanical. Relevant certifications or any related additional qualifications.     Proven experience 8-10 years as a Facility Operations Manager or similar role, managing multiple client facilities.     Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire staff to achieve collective goals.     In-depth knowledge of facility management best practices, industry standards, and safety regulations.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to foster positive client relationships and effectively collaborate with internal teams.     Analytical mindset with the ability to identify areas for improvement, implement strategies, and assess the impact of changes.     Proficiency in using facility management software and computer applications.
column11: Service level, Team management, Analytical, Billing, Hotel management, Resource allocation, Facility management, Operations, Service quality, Facility operations

column2: The Admissions Manager South Asia Hub provides operational leadership to the South Asia admissions teams on international admissions and enrolment matters by liaising with onshore international admissions team and other central units to ensure robust and efficient processes for the selection and admission of international students are in place and adhered to. This includes but is not limited to planning and developing international admissions operations, services, ensuring that international staff are adequately trained and relevant systems, processes and procedures are implemented.     The manager is expected to provide strategic and operational advice to senior management on all aspects of international admissions and related student and business services matters.     ?     ?     Key responsibilities:       Manage, mentor and provide effective leadership to admissions staff delivering high quality services to prospective international students and their agents, facilitating all stages of applications in a timely and cost effective manner.         Monitor all admissions processes to ensure that timelines, turnaround time and agreed KPIs are met. This includes monitoring admissions workloads and allocation of available resources to maintain business outputs, and the provision of regular training and updates on admissions systems and processes.         Conduct internal audits to ensure that applications are assessed correctly and consistently based on published entry requirements and the university admissions and selection policy. Identify areas of improvement and provide the team with training and regular updates to increase efficiency and accuracy and up to date knowledge in international education sector.         Work closely with Associate Director, Admissions, Pathways and Operations, Assistant Director, International Admissions and International Admissions Manager to develop, implement and review procedures to ensure the operations of admissions at the South Asia Hub as well as student appeals are undertaken in accordance with University policies, and legislation.         Work closely with Assistant Director, International Admissions to monitor and manage University s immigration evidentiary level for international students from South Asia.         Establish and maintain communication initiatives between South Asia Hub Admissions and other internal and external stakeholders including but not limited to international recruitment and Global Sales and Conversion to foster streamlined processes and problem solving mechanisms         Undertake regular comprehensive internal management reporting and monitoring on all aspects of South Asia Hub Admissions, including the provision of such reports to management and recruitment teams. Such reporting will include performance against targets, enrolments, pathways, tracking reports, predictive analyses and other related areas.         Provide regular training and updates to agent networks via webinar or face to face sessions to ensure collaborative approach.         Support marketing and recruitment initiatives for South Asia and ensure that admission requirements are factored into these initiatives.       Person Specification:       Significant management and leadership experience within the international tertiary education sector. Knowledge of Australian and overseas tertiary education, university systems and procedures is desirable.         Proven expertise in the coordination of people, resources and projects; and experience in initiating and managing change; prioritising, monitoring and evaluating work performance and flow; and meeting deadlines in a complex and demanding environment.         Proven ability to exercise initiative, to think strategically and creatively and to adopt an active approach to problem-solving.         Excellent verbal and written communication and negotiation skills, including the ability to deal effectively with a diverse range of clients, partners, stakeholders and authorities, and demonstrated experience in the preparation of policy documents, high quality briefings, submissions, reports and correspondence.         Strong customer service orientation and proven experience in relationship management.         Demonstrated experience in the ability to work with and understand the needs of clients from a diverse range of cultural and socioeconomic backgrounds.         Demonstrated experience in the use of standard office desktop software as well as more advanced applications in preparation of various spreadsheets and reporting formats.         Significant and current knowledge of the student visa program and simplified student visa framework in order to effectively manage University s evidentiary level (risk rating)         Demonstrate an in-depth knowledge in compliance and legislative requirement related to international students including but not limited to ESOS Legislative and TEQSA National Code of Practice.         Significant knowledge of international qualifications and assessment of overseas student applications including assessment of English proficiency         Education:       Postgraduate qualifications and extensive relevant experience; or an equivalent combination of qualifications and extensive relevant experience. Fluency in a language other than English is desirable.

column2: Opportunity Besides an attractive remuneration package, working for VRSA gives you the opportunity to join a high-growth platform that is leading the transformation of Indias urban built environment. In this multi-faceted role, you will be working directly with the companys senior leadership, and will get be responsible for operational efficiencies and cost optimisation for VR Punjab, with a focus on the retail component of the asset.   Supporting Actions   Business Operations  Lead the business   operations team via executing and coordinating sound strategies towards   achieving the budgets; Ensure the operational SOPs are in place and   the guidelines are adhered by all departments, service providers and/or   tenants; Drive the implementation of Asset Enhance Initiatives (AEI), which   could involve centre expansion, refurbishments/repurposing spaces, and other   strategic initiatives at the centre; Follow legal procedures with respect to mall operations and tenant   interactions; Support all tenants, departments and vendors   to remain fully compliant (labour, building permissions, pollution control,   water, fire inspections, property tax etc.) and liaison with civic agencies   to ensure smooth operations of facilities; Ensure all tenant/   retailer/service provider documentation are in-place as per pre-defined SOPs; Work with the tenant   coordination team in transitioning from the executed contract through to the   handover of tenant spaces and commencement of fit out, through to trading; Conduct frequent retailer audits (store front audits, brand &   store & safety audits, retailer statutory compliance audits, fire &   safety audit, etc.); Conduct regular meetings with store managers & area managers to   understand & discuss business & other critical operational issues;  Manage tenant survey and retailer research and satisfaction survey; Responsible for the ADSR implementation, coordination with agency,   handling escalations etc.; Perform routine inspection of the property to   ensure that all vendors appointed for property management are adhering to   SLAs and day to day operations of mall are well taken care of;  Support the   facility manager and/or service provider for facilities management for any   support related to operational efficiencies, liaison, etc. Escalate any   non-performance and/or compliance issues to the central SPOC managing all   facility management vendors. Ensuring monthly   collections against billing for the month to retailers Reconciliation of   the brand accounts through coordination with the deployed outsourced agency. Collection of   outstanding dues   Sales and Marketing Support Support execution of leasing activities of both new and renewals   across all categories including: Anchors, line units, F&B and leisure; Support sales & marketing team to ensure successful leasing of   promotional spaces to garner revenue;  Oversee   implementation of ATL, BTL, TTL, Guerilla marketing campaigns and brand   strategies.   Relationship Management Maintain effective relationship with government and other agencies for   obtaining various clearances, approvals; Develop and maintain a long   term beneficial relationship with all existing tenants a to ensure continued   and future business; To ensure smooth and positive   relationship with the tenants, suppliers and contractors; Resolves complaints and demands   of tenants and work to remove the causes of the complaint and respond to   their requests within the legal and contractual obligations; Oversee / hold vendor / tenant   meeting at regular intervals;   MIS, Reporting Forecasting   operating budgets for the centre and ensure the set operating budgets are   met; Maximizing NOI through a deliberate process of increasing all   potential income sources, while controlling expenses; Prepare TD report & sales analysis of   operational stores in the centre, benchmark performance with the external   market, TD and OC analysis YOY (retailer category wise); Work with relevant vendors and finance team on debtors ageing   analysis, budget variance analysis; Monthly monitoring of tenants rental arrears to ensure they are kept   to a minimum;  Budget management   of campaigns in line with overall marketing budget and event wise ROI   analysis; Monthly / quarterly   presentation to the management on overall mall management. column2: We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Event Operations Manager to join our dynamic team. As the Event Operations Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the planning, coordination, and execution of various events. Your role will involve a deep understanding of fabrication and vendor coordination, as well as a keen eye for detail. Additionally, a good understanding of technology and a passion for learning are essential for this position.       Responsibilities           Plan, coordinate, and execute events from start to finish, ensuring seamless operations and exceptional attendee experience.         Collaborate with internal teams and external vendors to manage event logistics, including venue selection, budgeting, equipment rental, and transportation.         Oversee fabrication processes, ensuring timely delivery of event materials and maintaining quality standards.         Manage vendor relationships, negotiate contracts, and ensure compliance with agreed-upon terms and conditions.         Develop and maintain event timelines and production schedules, ensuring all tasks are completed on time and within budget.         Conduct on-site inspections to ensure event spaces are set up according to specifications and troubleshoot any issues that may arise.         Provide leadership and guidance to the event operations team, fostering a collaborative and high-performing work environment.         Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies, incorporating innovative solutions into event operations when applicable.         Continuously evaluate event processes and implement improvements to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.         job requirements       Proven experience as an Event Operations Manager or similar role, with a track record of successfully executing events of varying scales.       In-depth understanding of fabrication processes and experience in coordinating with vendors to ensure timely delivery of event materials.         Strong attention to detail, with the ability to oversee multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.         Familiarity with technology trends and their application in event management.         Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with internal teams, external vendors, and clients.         Proactive mindset with a willingness to learn and grow within an experiential team environment.         Exceptional organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.         Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and travel as required by event schedules.

column2: Overview: We are seeking an experienced Senior Manager of Operations to oversee the efficient and effective functioning of the power plant within our integrated facility. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in managing operations, specifically with Waste Heat Recovery Boiler (WHRB), and a solid background in power plant management. Responsibilities: Operational Management : Lead the day-to-day operations of the power plant, ensuring smooth functioning and adherence to operational standards. WHRB Expertise : Utilize in-depth knowledge and expertise in Waste Heat Recovery Boiler operations to optimize efficiency and minimize downtime. Team Leadership : Manage a team of operations staff, providing guidance, training, and support to ensure maximum productivity and safety. Maintenance Oversight : Coordinate with maintenance teams to schedule and execute preventative maintenance activities, minimizing disruptions to operations. Compliance : Ensure compliance with all relevant safety, environmental, and regulatory requirements, maintaining necessary documentation and records. Performance Monitoring : Implement monitoring systems and processes to track the performance of the power plant and identify areas for improvement. Troubleshooting : Address any operational issues or emergencies promptly, implementing solutions to minimize impact on plant operations. Budget Management : Assist in the development and management of the operations budget, controlling costs and optimizing resources. Continuous Improvement : Identify opportunities for process optimization and efficiency improvements, implementing changes as necessary. Stakeholder Communication : Liaise with other departments and stakeholders to coordinate activities and ensure alignment with overall organizational goals. Risk Management : Identify and mitigate operational risks, implementing appropriate controls and contingency plans. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Engineering or related field; advanced degree preferred. Minimum of 15 years of experience in power plant operations, with a focus on WHRB. Proven experience in a leadership or management role, with strong team management skills. Thorough understanding of power plant operations, including WHRB systems, steam turbines, generators, and related equipment. Knowledge of relevant safety, environmental, and regulatory requirements. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot operational issues effectively. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders. Proven track record of driving operational excellence and continuous improvement initiatives. Ability to work effectively under pressure and manage multiple priorities simultaneously. This role offers an exciting opportunity for an experienced operations professional to lead the power plant operations within our integrated facility. If you meet the qualifications and are passionate about driving operational excellence, we encourage you to apply.
column11: POWERPLANT, WHRB, Operations

column2: Our Culture Question the status quo:  we question the way things are done and encourage people to try new ways of doing things, as long as the risks are calculated. Transparency:  We believe in an environment of complete transparency. There are no wrong questions and feedback doesnt need to be sugar-coated. Go-getter spirit:  Were dealing with big problems and competitors with deep pockets. You??e joining a team that solves difficult problems with creativity and hustle. Obsessed with finding and solving consumer pain points:  As a team, we??e fixated on serving our consumers and keeping the consumer's needs before all else. What Are Your Responsibilities? Manufacturing Oversight:  Overseeing each production batch at our manufacturing facility 35 minutes away from our office, and ensuring each batch production follows our quality standards. Amazon and E-Commerce Order Fulfillment:  ensuring our operations team is adequately fulfilling e-commerce (Amazon), quick commerce, and direct website orders promptly. Additionally, ensuring that customer queries and complaints are supported with expedient responses from our team. Supply Chain Expertise:  developing a team to gain end-to-end control over LightYears??supply chain of raw materials, ingredients, packaging materials, and labels. Innovating in identifying differentiated and cost-effective ingredient and packaging suppliers. Management and Oversight of Regular Product Testing Protocols:  ensuring all our products follow the testing protocol set up by the R&D team. What Qualifications Are We Looking For? Bachelor's degree is required. B.Sc. or B.Tech. in Food Sciences or Biotechnology or Bachelors in Pharmacy (B. Pharmacy) is preferred. 4+ years of experience in managing e-commerce operations for a consumer products company is required. Experience managing Shopify and/or Amazon FBA operations is preferred. Experience in managing supply chain and manufacturing operations for food and/or nutraceutical companies is preferred. What Qualities Are We Looking For? Hustler.  We are a team of hustlers, and we are looking to grow the team with people who have a go-getter mentality for the goals they set. A keen learner.  We??e looking for people who are willing to learn new hard and soft skills on the job. A new company offers many challenges and opportunities, and each presents you with a steep learning curve. We are looking for a candidate who embraces the learning process. Agility and Adaptability.  As we launch in the market, our operations will be nimble and you will be required to adapt to changing market situations, growing operations, and pivoting product strategies. Creative Thinking.  You will be required to think of unconventional solutions for problems we have. We??e solving big, fuzzy problems and we??e looking for unconventional thinkers to solve these problems.  How to Take This Forward? If you are interested in applying for this position, email us your resume at hello@elevateconsumer.com. After reviewing all applications, we will contact selected candidates for an in-person interview. If you have any further questions, you can email us at hello@elevateconsumer.com.

Job Description:   As an Operations Manager at PARKPLUS, you will be responsible for overseeing the efficient functioning of both the parking and hardware sales aspects of our business. You will play a key role in ensuring seamless operations, managing client relationships, and driving business growth in the Delhi NCR market.  Key Responsibilities:  Full stag parking business operations and hardware sales. Team Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless coordination and alignment of business strategies with overall company objectives. Oversee the management of overnight vehicles site-wise, implementing security measures and policies. column2: Job Description: Operations Manager Company Overview Accurate Bearing Components is a leading manufacturer of child parts, specializing in steering and suspension linkages for the automotive industry. Our state-of-the-art facility houses cutting-edge processes, including cold forging, CNC turning, heat treatment, and grinding. We take pride in our commitment to quality, efficiency, and innovation. Position: Operations Manager Role Overview As an Operations Manager at Accurate Bearing Components, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing our production processes, ensuring seamless operations, and maintaining high-quality standards. Your expertise will drive efficiency, optimize workflows, and contribute to the success of our organization. Responsibilities Process Management: Cold Forging: Leverage your in-depth knowledge of cold forging techniques to enhance productivity and minimize waste. CNC Turning: Monitor CNC turning operations, streamline programming, and improve machining efficiency. Heat Treatment: Ensure precise heat treatment processes for optimal material properties. Grinding: Oversee grinding operations, emphasizing precision and surface finish quality. Production Leadership: Lead a team of 60 operators across various departments. Implement best practices to achieve production targets, reduce lead time, and enhance on-time delivery. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address bottlenecks and quality issues. Quality Assurance: Maintain rigorous quality control standards throughout the manufacturing process. Implement root cause analysis and corrective actions to address any deviations. Drive continuous improvement initiatives to elevate product quality.     Maintenance Division Oversight : Establish and manage the Maintenance Division, ensuring optimal equipment performance. Coordinate preventive and predictive maintenance schedules. Collaborate with maintenance technicians to minimize downtime and maximize uptime. Implement reliability-centered maintenance practices. Supply Chain Coordination : Work closely with procurement and inventory management teams to optimize material flow. Ensure timely availability of raw materials and components. Safety and Compliance: Uphold safety protocols and promote a culture of safety awareness. Comply with industry regulations and internal policies. Performance Evaluation and Training : Conduct regular performance evaluations for operators. Provide training and skill development opportunities. Qualifications Education: Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering or Diploma in Mechanical Engineering Experience: Minimum 15 years of experience in managing production and quality in an automotive manufacturing environment. Skills: Process optimization Supply chain management Quality assurance Team leadership Lean manufacturing principles Inventory control Accurate Bearing Components is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds.
